description:
Firehouse is delicious!
They must use some of the freshest ingredients... their veggie supreme is awesome and the kiddos even love the crust!
We go here all the time.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Crust is like eating bad matzah bread (think cardboard). Pizza did not come with expected toppings.. one had iceberg lettuce when it should have had spinach... and one had broccoli pieces when it should have had jalapeños. What the heck is that about?

Delivery took 30 minutes longer than promised.

I've been wanting to try this neighborhood spot for a while, and am very disappointed. Will not return.
author: Ian B.

description: This is as close to an Ohio/Midwest pie as I have found in SF, great spot for takeout.
author: Tom R.

description: Firehouse Pizza is AMAZING!  I'm originally from Chicago and their pizza reminds me of home!  All of their Specialty Pizzas are to die for ....as is their Mac & Chesse w/ Bacon!  I've tried many here in SF and Firehouse Pizza in the Richmond District is THE BEST IN SAN FRANCISCO and Jessie went above and beyond for me.  I'd highly recommend everything on their menu...yummmmm!!!!!
author: Kelly H.

description: Their garlic knots are perhaps one of my favorite food sins around. Some days I'll just be dreaming about those greasy, flakey, hot mini bread rolls lightly sprinkled with Parmesan cheese and sometimes a little burnt on the bottom. I am guilty of ordering just them sometimes when I give into my craving. I have yet to try the pizza as it feels pricey for me, but for the garlic knots alone I give 4 stars.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
They no longer make their gluten free crust in house. Tastes like Udi's to me!   

Please bring back your hand made crust pleaseeeee????
author: Reena T.

description: Decided to try this place out since I pass it often. Big mistake. I read many negative yelp reviews first, but still I like to try for myself. $25 for a large Margherita pizza it was a huge disappointment. I actually feel the quality is lower than frozen store bought $4 pizzas. The cheese had barely any flavor and the crust tasted like stale crackers. Service was as expected from the yelp reviews, unkind cashier.
author: Hoku L.

description:
The guy answering the phone is EXTREMELY rude. Younger sounding guy with a slight accent. Called to place an order and when he asked my address and I gave it to him and mentioned I was at a hospital. I asked do you want to know where I am. He said he knew where I was. I asked him if he could tell me what building and room I was in... he didn't know so i told him.

1 hour and 20 minutes go by and I call back to ask the status of my order. He cuts me off with "it's on it's way". How do you know which order I am? All I said was I placed an order nearly 1.5 hours ago. Am I the only one around that time who ordered food? 

I'm actually still waiting for the pizza as I type. It's been about 1 hour and 45 minutes now since I ordered. I will cancel my order shortly. I've never cancelled food due to being late. This will be the first time. To the owner of the business, get somebody else to answer your phone. Your food is not great to endure this service.
author: Minh L.

description:
This place used to be my go-to local pizza delivery, but noticed that quality and consistency isn't as great as it used to be. Today when I ordered they said it would be at my house in 45 minutes (I also left clear instructions to call me when they arrive because the doorbell rings my landlord - and the guy on the phone kept repeating "ok and call you when we get there?" at which I was responding "yes"). 

After 1hr15min passed and still no pizza, I called to get an update, they then told me my pizza was coming out of the oven and would be at my house in about 10 minutes. 20 more minutes go by and my landlord comes down to tell me someone's been ringing their doorbell. I go and see that it's the pizza - woohoo! Almost an hour later than they said it would be, but I was just happy to see the food. 

Then they guy asked me what I ordered, realized he forgot my dressings, apologized and took a dollar off the total. And I totally appreciate him trying to make it right in the moment, but also would have rather had those dressings I ordered. Then when I opened the pizza inside, it was totally burned all around the crust. 

All in all I won't be ordering from them anymore which is a shame since they used to be my #1.
author: Maggie F.

description: We live in the area and order pickup from Firehouse all the time. They have great vegetarian options and the pizza is delicious!
author: Lauren M.

description: Love this pizza place because I love thin crust pizza. My go-to neighborhood pizza spot. I usually go for the Hawaiian specialty pizza. The crust is always thin but crispy and never soggy. The owner and employees are very nice. Attached to a grocery store so you can also pick up some drinks next door.
author: Will T.

description: Excellent food, even better service! The workers created a very friendly environment, even to the point where when my phone was at low battery, the guy let me use his portable charger! Which is well above and beyond the service I expected, so it's safe to say that the restaurant blew my expectations out of the water! the pizza was reasonably priced and delicious! Would highly recommend!
author: Eli G.

description:
pizza 45 minutes late, and was of course cold.  Then we noticed it was missing two of the ingredients we paid for.  Called to complain, the guy didn't even try to apologize.  Just sat there quietly and said, he was busy.  

I had been a client of them since they opened, but I don't think I'll order from them again.
author: B J.

description:
I've looked past the time you forgot to make my pizza. I've looked past the multiple times I have received burnt or the wrong pizza. I've looked past the forgotten or incorrect salads but no more...

After not being able to order a pizza for pick up today online. I waited on hold for 40 minutes. Okay I was multitasking but seriously that wait time is not acceptable. Nobody ever picked up the phone.

I hope you start a larger place someday where you can afford quality control. You were so good when you first opened. l hope you find that again someday. Until then, there are way too many mediocre pizza places out there...we don't need one more.
author: John D.

description:
This place is the reason !ahem! a certain irl frendo who will remain unnamed coughsandycough was collectively forbidden from ordering pizza for the group ever again.

No matter how - app, phone, web, app+phone... orders by our unknown person were always punked with cheese no matter how many times or ways "no cheese" was requested.

Drinking has DDs, Designated Drivers. Pizzaing has PPs, Prevented Purchasers. Rest of us live mas.
author: Dan B.

description: I went in person to Firehouse.  They were very busy making online orders and other orders.  I had to wait about 10 minutes before they took my order.  The workers were very busy and not very polite.  When I wanted to change my order,the first worker said that they could not.  But the 2nd worker making the pizza was willing to change the order and did.  I had to wait a total of about 30 minutes to get my pizza.  The pizza was pretty good if you want to order it to go.  The place is not very nice to eat at. The next time I would call to order the pizza or order it online.
author: Betty C.

description:
Sooooo good! 
I've been looking for a pizza place like this for a long time. I'm so glad I found this with my friend for lunch. They are priced perfectly, and make the pizza just right. I am highly satisfied. The guys working today were friendly and helpful.
author: Jess S.

description: Store bought pizza is better.  Also check out worker is slightly rude.
author: Sarah S.

description: Umph, so disappointed. As a vegan I was stoked to find another pizza place that has vegan cheese. Well, on my SECOND BITE, there was a stray piece of sausage. As a non meat eater this literally made me gag and want to vomit. Next, why has no one talked about the crust? It's burnt, hard, and just plain nasty. Won't be coming back here again.
author: Sophia F.

description: Very small spot offering pizzas to go and for delivery.  Their Hawaiian Luau Pizza - with ham, bacon, pineapple and a bbq drizzle - is amazing!  Go check that one out.
author: Paul M.

description: Overall fairly disappointing. Prices and pizza sizes vary across different menus, and the pizza looks very appetizing but the crust is dry and like a cracker and has a very bad taste to it. Almost 10$ for a 6 inch cheese pizza and a coke is too much for what was received.
author: Miles M.

description:
4 stars for the pizza, zero stars for the service. Delivery always takes at least an hour, which is something we could live with since the pizza was tasty. 

Last month we ordered a pizza and called to inquire about it an hour and 15 minutes after ordering. They said they were understaffed and it would arrive soon. It arrived 15 minutes later and after the driver left we discovered it was the wrong pizza. I called and after being on hold for several minutes let them know the situation and they said they would bring us a new pizza in 20 minutes and email us a coupon for a free one. 30 minutes later the driver arrived and complained about how tired he was. The pizza he brought was obviously the original (now super cold) pizza and they never emailed that coupon. 

If you are hungry and care about which toppings you get on your pizza I would not recommend ordering from Firehouse.
author: Lauren T.

description: BURNT BURNT BURNT! It's not the first time, but it will be the last. Every time I order it's either an incorrect pizza, burnt, soggy or super late. What's worse is their customer service. Rude, defensive and likely hang up on you.
author: A O.

description: My local favorite pizza spot in the Outer Richmond. Friendly service just as good as the pies they dish out. Large sausage and pineapple is my go-to. Usually a 25 - 40 minute lead time for pickup, and one hour for delivery. Street parking is fairly limited so be sure to put your hazard lights if you're stopping by. I definitely recommend!
author: Tony B.

description:
My Husband & I have been coming here for their Garlic Knots every year during Memorial Day Weekend for the last 4 years and they NEVER disappoint ... until yesterday 
They were burnt / completely over cooked and didn't have any oil or garlic; they just had parmesan cheese on them.
This is not the usual and I really hope whoever made them yesterday figures out what they did wrong so we continue to come back and spread the word.
author: MICHELLE MARIE W.

description:
Oh so good!!! Nothing more needed to say!!!!
Delivery's wonderful!  Great place! Give them a call!
author: Karen R.

description:
Great pizza. Quick service. One star taken off coz the pizza makers were not wearing gloves. 

Seating outside only for a group of more than 3.
author: Vinu Y.

description:
Decent pizza....Nothing spectacular 

We asked for the pizzas well done and they weren't. The meat toppings were SO sparse. There were probably 2-3 small pieces of sausage on every piece of pizza.

Online ordering is nice and it's really easy but I probably won't be back.
author: Erin L.

description: Great pizza but without a doubt the worst execution and delivery time. We were originally quoted for 1 hour and 20 minutes order to doorstep, after over an hour and a half the storefront claimed the order was in its way, the storefront is 5-7 minutes away on a bad day and at over 2 house still no order. I highly recommend any other pizza spot if you want an honest answer and an reasonable delivery time. Total fail.
author: Gregory J.

description: Solid pizza that's a decent value. Nothing special but gets the job done. You can order delivery too and they'll bring it right to your door in a pretty timely fashion. Sometimes the guy who takes your order can be challenging on the phone, but gut it out and you'll get some good grub.
author: Patrick W.

description: Great Pizza! Great Service on delivery! I'm sorry I didn't write a review sooner! YUMMY!!!! Thanks Firehouse Pizzeria!!
author: Josie S.

description:
I don't need to remind you how important first impressions are. The man at the register was very polite which was a plus. But I'm going to go straight to the food. 

The chopped salad we ordered was mediocre. Romaine lettuce with chopped tomatoes and cucumbers. With some cheese and avocado. That's literally all there is in it. 

Pizza: we ordered hawaiian, supreme, spicy cheeseburger, and margherita. The margherita prepared to us was diced tomatoes with cheese. Where'd the basil, garlic and olive oil go? Honestly for the price and reputation, I expected more. Very disappointed that they would slip up like that. I'll probably give them one more try before taking my business back to Gaspares!

Word of advice: check your pizzas before you leave.
author: Greg Y.

description:
Overall decent pizza. We got a veggie pizza w/ extra cheese - chock full of super fresh veggies, but extremely sparse on the cheese, and the crust was really hard if not overbaked. Nothing out of this world but solid and satisfying after walking around for 10+ miles that day. Service was friendly and helpful.

Seating is minimal - inside at a bar-type thing facing the wall or outside near the [not too crowded] street.
author: Leanna W.

description: How does it take 75 mins to get a pizza from half mile away?! I called to find out where my pizza 25 mins after my food was supposed to be delivered and the person on the phone sounded annoyed that I called. My pizza finally arrived barely warm and wrong. I called to complain and the guy on the phone was rude. So basically I spent almost 2 hours and $40 for a crappy experience...thanks Firehouse.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The website and Yelp say they open at 1130am but they're still not open at 1145. Now I won't have time to eat here before going to work.
author: Brandon M.

description: Seems like a lot of the reviews are about the poor delivery service but since a live 2 blocks away we always do pick ups and Firehouse hasn't disappointed. The pizzas have the perfect crust - thin but crispy - with delicious options for toppings. Pizzas are cooked perfectly each time. There was only one time when our order wasn't ready when we arrived and we had to wait 15 minutes; otherwise the pizzas were always ready at the time promised. This is our favorite neighborhood pizza place!
author: Cee J.

description: Love this place. In a city filled with pretentious pizza offerings, this place makes a mark. Fresh ingredients, thin crust, great combos. I've been doing take out here for years. This review has been long due and well deserved.
author: Peter K.

description: Good pizza place for families.  Our favorite is the thin crust with pepperoni and meat balls.  Don't forget to buy their pesto to go as well.  You can reheat at home and pour over some pasta for a full meal.  It never disappoints.
author: Gab T.

description:
Oh boy ! They are close the only benefit here. We ordered a pizza last week ok salami and cheese extra sauce. Pizza arrives HAM and pineapple so the guy says he made a mistake ok give him a break but then we find out the pizza is burned up. He sends another one with the salami black olives and cheese no extra sauce . So the crows got the burnt pizza and the guy 
downstairs got the second one end of story lousy. What would you do ?
It will be quite a while I don't have a short memory and it's nothing like golden boy so there you have it.
author: Stef M.

description:
I used to really really like this place,  i really dont know what happened. 

Extremely poor quality pizza.
Extremely poor delivery time.
I should have ordered round table i think i wouldve been happier.  Will never return again.
author: Moto B.

description:
OK, I hate so many pizzas in San Francisco, that my son in law thinks I do not like pizza.  I am from Chicago, and we ate thin crust, not thick, in my neighborhood.  Just moved to Ocean Beach, and on a walk smelled this pizza place.  Saw they delivered.  How can I possible give five stars to a place that took well over an hour to deliver?  Well, because it was the best thin crust pizza I have had in this town.  Arrived hot, tasty and perfect with a nice crispy crust.  Sausage with perfect fennel.  Slight smoky flavor from the oven.  I have found my go to pizza place, worth the wait.

Update: I have ordered pizzas about 4 more times since I wrote the above review, and to put it mildly, the quality is variable.  This last time, the crust was so greasy it actually was soggy.  Delivery times have consistently improved, however.  Caveat emptor.
author: Gene B.

description:
Firehouse Pizzeria is one of the few places that delivers pizza to my neighborhood with crust on the thinner crust. Just what I like! The crust is crispy, but still retains a nice chew since it's not super thin. Last time I ordered delivery was back in May 2012.

*6" pizza with pepperoni and mushroom http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/firehouse-pizzeria-san-francisco#ZTUwqrsor6DbvNPCuPpeIA
*10" Supreme Pizza (no olives) with jalapenos http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/firehouse-pizzeria-san-francisco#QUfl1eBJfEAatj0QrdKgYA
*10" Spicy Bacon Cheeseburger Pizza http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/firehouse-pizzeria-san-francisco#JLZOEoTGRPCq3z-g2EUhnw
*Chopped Salad http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/firehouse-pizzeria-san-francisco#8rQ0XnmWKpDWVSM5_wIi9Q
*Cheesy Bread http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/firehouse-pizzeria-san-francisco#RCRcqYTp5eRklKvqGb_18w
*Mac N Cheese w/Smoked Bacon http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/firehouse-pizzeria-san-francisco#jF0XejxtEcqV3k2xNdPswg

The pizzas were great! I like that they offer a 6" personal pizza since at times, the roommate and I have very different tastes in toppings. Since the pizza crust is on the thinner side, it can take more than one pizza to fill you up. So if you're super hungry, Order a couple different ones or go for the larger sized pizzas.

When I used to order from them, they didn't have an online ordering option. You had to phone it in the old school way. Now that I can order online, I may be getting delivery from them again soon!
author: Elena N.

description:
We just got done biking the Golden Gate Bridge and were starving! So happy this place caught our eye while searching Yelp. 

It was some of the best pizza I've had. We ordered the Greek pesto and couldn't have asked for better.  I usually don't enjoy thin crust, but it was perfectly crisp yet chewy. They are generous with the cheese which is always a plus. It tasted fresh and flavorful. Their garlic knots are to die for! Check in and get a free order (6). Hot, melted buttery, cheesy goodness ... What's not to love? The knots come with a side of marinara. 

The service was fast and friendly. The place itself is pretty tiny. They have a counter that sits about 5 people then there is outside seating. I wouldn't recommend it for large groups unless you take it to go.
author: Tonni R.

description:
How did I just find out about this place when I live so close to it? The pizza is amazing! It's a thin crust pizza, well toasted on the bottom with a nice amount of soft bread. Not an overwhelming amount where I feel like I'm eating way too much carbs, but not so little where I feel like I'm eating a toasted tortilla - it was perfect! 

I came with my boyfriend and a friend and we ordered two medium pizzas and it was just the perfect amount. 

We got the margherita pizza and it was very cheesy which I like. The cheese was stretchy when I bit into it - yummm! It was a very light tasting dish even though there were a lot of cheese. 

We also got the BBQ chicken pizza. The BBQ sauce was not overwhelming, it had the perfect amount of chicken, and onions. 

I can't get over the dough. It was the best part of the pizza - the thickness and toasty-ness was perfect! I'm surprised I like this place as much as I do seeing that I'm not a big fan of pizza. Maybe it's because we ate there when the pizza was still hot out of the oven. I need to order it to go next time to see if I still like it just as much. 

I'm already craving some more and I just had some yesterday!
author: Michelle T.

description: This place is great!!!  The pizza was the best I've had in the SF area.  The ingredients were the highest quality and the crust was done perfectly (just enough crunch but not overcooked).  You could definitely tell that the owners put a lot of effort into making a great product.  The staff was super friendly as well.  A large pepperoni, mushroom and onion pizza only cost $23 INCLUDING the delivery fee and tax!!!  This is definitely several cuts above a Domino's-type pizza and is actually a lot cheaper and with a friendlier staff to boot!!!  Oh, and they are part of this 'Slice' network of local Pizza companies that help promote local small business pizza companies who are being squeezed out by the big box companies.  So, it's a great way to support your local community as well.  I'm so glad I found this place!!!
author: Ed R.

description:
Firehouse pizza is not using good food handling guidelines and it's pretty filthy in there.

I saw two employees go from preparing food to using the register without any hand washing.

I then saw them cook raw sausage on a mesh pizza round in the oven. Then removed from the oven and reused. Their peel is used as a cutting board and then rested on the floor.

Too risky for me,
author: Perry V.

description: Burnt pizza. Come on! You guys used to be good. This is my third burnt one because I kept believing it was a mistake. :(
author: Kirsten H.

description: 5 stars because the guys here work really hard and I had the best gluten free vegetarian pizza of my life here the other night. WORTH THE WAIT!
author: Linda N.

description: First, a comment about quality. It cannot be good by definition. Firehouse uses cheapest ingredients plain and simple which is not hard to see. Crappy gas station-grade cheese which is anything but mozzarella that I requested and paid for. I've never seen rectangular-shaped slices of ham outside Food Bank and ... well my $30 pizza. I have no comments about the taste of dough or tomato paste because the base had no taste. Copious amounts of stuff that you don't really want in large quantities like olives or onions. Classic case of when you can't give them substance, dazzle them with bullshit. They manage to deliver cold pizza within 10 blocks. A dyslexic gent on the phone who wrote down both the order and the address wrong. Or delivery guy was knocking on a neighbor's door and had to return to the base. When he finally came back more than one hour after I placed the order, he managed to drop one of the pizzas at my feet. The remaining one was ice cold and had wrong ingredients and Firehouse makes it a point to cut a large pie into at least 20 pieces, making each slice barely an inch wide. This is just retarded. Who sells or eats pizza this way? Showering us with apologies, they offered to remake both pizzas. Another 45 minutes later, we got nasty yellow-colored circle masquerading as mozzarella cheese pizza AND the other in wrong size with the wrong ingredients once again. If it's 2 AM and you drunk and starving, this crap my do the job. Otherwise I will never touch this stuff with a stick again.
author: RJ S.

description: Fantastic pizza, even has gluten free options! Garlic knots are small, but plentiful. Outdoor seating is a plus, though not too many chairs and tables. Worth the wait!
author: Martie A.

description:
Ordered once and it took a while and pizza was kind of cold.  But that's OK, I used to deliver pizzas and that happens if you happen to be the last one delivered. So I tried them again.

Pizza showed up after 2 hours and was stone cold.  But the driver was apologetic and said to call back and they'd give me a free pizza next time.  Fair enough, things happen.  I even gave him a good tip.  

So I called back a few weeks later to take him up on his offer.  Guy says he's not a manager and can't honor it (I order anyway, comes in 1 hour 15 min, kinda cold).  I call back another time and get the same story.

I finally call and get the manager.  He scoffs and says "I never agreed to that!"

Sorry, no thanks.  Plenty of other pizza places if you want a cold pizza and poor service.
author: Bumbaklot R.

description: Meh. I've experienced better pizza that was not made by a person who doesn't wash his hands after handling cash (call me old fashioned) and doesn't have his butt crack showing while scraping burn't crap from the oven. I can't believe I still ate the pizza, but as a mediocre looking friend once said, "pizza is like sex, its still always still kinda good". Thats the attitude I had while eating my personal pizza into the sunset along baker beach. It was disgusting and romantic at the same time.
author: Mikee C.

description:
When the pizza is fresh-out-the-oven-burn-the-roof-of-your-mouth hot it's good.  Once it cools down to an edible temperature it's just not that great.  Good quality mozzarella, but the ratio of cheese to toppings to crust to cornmeal is not ideal.  I am a fan of thin crust but these guys are a little absurd.  The crust is paper thin and thickly coated with cornmeal.

Other good things to note that had no effect on my rating: no indoor seating, a few cratchety small tables out front, long wait while they cook your pizza, priced similarly to chain pizza joints.

No pizza went to waste, hence the A-OK rating, but I will never return.
author: Brooke R.

description: Two stars for the joyful and diligent workers, and the generous toppings but for those allergic to gluten like me, please be aware that cooking surface and utensils are shared with gluten-FULL foods. I asked the guy at register if the pizza was cooked on a different surface and he said "yes". He must've misheard or misunderstood my question. I was surprised and sad when I saw the shared surfaces and utensils...the pizza shouldn't be presented as gluten-free because it is no longer gluten-free once it hits that oven. Other places have had dedicated pans for GF pizzas. I'd recommend that here.
author: Cat T.

description: Solid place with great pizza!! Tonight I ordered 2 pizzas online and I messed up the toppings, so I called them to fix my mistake. A nice gentleman answered the phone right away and made sure my pizzas were made to spec. He quoted a 45 minute wait, but they showed up early 30-some minutes later -- woohoo! The delivery man was polite and efficient. Now for the pizzas: They were YUM. My husband and I shared a gluten-free with pesto, sausage, and bell peppers....the crust was flavorful and crisp with a touch of chewiness, just the way I like. Our teen kids shared a regular sausage pizza and they finished it off within minutes - they described it as "super tasty." I deducted one star only because both pizzas had a little too much cheese, and I find that whenever that happens the cheese layer turns into a solid mass that slides off the crust. But this is a common issue with delivered pizza, so no biggie. Overall, we had a lovely experience and will order from Firehouse again!
author: SfMom O.

description: Unfortunately Firehouse seems to have changed it's management.  Pizza is not a good as last year and the service is terrible
author: Rick R.

description: What a waste of time. Ordered a pizza at 4:58. Received a pizza at 10. I talked to many people over the phone. Promised a free future pizza and a comped salad. Received a "cheesy bread" with our pizza instead. It became comical after a point with my friend and we turned it into a drinking game to see how long it would take to deliver the pizza. I can't even review the pizza here because the pressing issue is that it took almost 4 hours to deliver a simple pizza. I could have cured the pepperoni myself and baked the pizza faster than they could deliver it.
author: Chris H.

description: Garlic knots & med pizza for $20 BOOYAH!!
author: Miguel E.

description: great pizza joint! friendly,fast and clean! Chicken club w/ pineapples! straight fire in the Fire House!
author: Bee Z.

description:
Went here with some friends - two of us wanted salad and 3 wanted pizza, so we settled on this place. 

The salad- I ordered the Greek. And it was quite a disappointment. Not enough of anything besides lettuce - hardly tasted the feta or olives and TOO much vinegar in their dressing. It overwhelmed the flavor I would have gotten from the miniscule amount of cheese in my salad. Thankfully I convinced someone to share the salad with me so that I could eat some of the pizza and get the vinegar taste out of my mouth. 

The pizza - I snagged a piece from my freinds' large supreme pizza. Meh. Tasted like a pretty mediocre pizza. In their defence, it's not the pizza special I would have ordered. Maybe other pizzas would be more to my liking, but thanks to the underwhelming dining experience, I probably won't be going back to try out others.
author: Sarah S.

description:
We were at the pet store and noticed Firehouse for the first time ever. The BF and I thought it was a new pizza joint but I think they've been around for a little while now! How did we not know this sooner?? We've been trying to eat semi healthy but pizza seemed to be shouting our names all weekend long. So... We gave in and why not- Sunday night called for pizza delivery! They said it would take an hour but they came in approx 45min so that was great!

We ordered the largest pizza.. Half Hawaiian Luau and half Veggie Supreme (w/ added pesto, pepperoni and garlic)! The Hawaiian was my favorite! Guys.. I can't even forget about the Cheesy Bread.. It was deadly! I'm going to get the garlic knots next time too! Sucks they wouldn't let us use the free garlic knots for a delivery order. Firehouse hit the spot so I def recommend!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I was watching the warriors game at the Blarney Stone Friday night. They don't serve food but I noticed a pizza delivery lady. We talked and she said she was from firehouse. We pulled up the menu on our phone and the Hawaiian specialty pizza caught our eye. 

19 bucks later and I don't know how long but the pizza showed up. Freaking amazing. Bacon ham pineapple and BBQ sauce. Sauce was a bit spicy but amazing. So good that the guy next to us offered money for a slice. We gave him one and wouldn't accept money. He later bought us a round of shots. 

Next time I'm in this neighborhood id definitely like to check out the experience sitting down. Ill definitely order here if I'm hungry at Blarney Stone again.
author: Marty J.

description: This was our go to pizza place. We loved it when it first opened  , it was good  pizza. But I don't know what happened the quality is not the same somewhat poor, and at times it took two hours to get a pizza delivered . We stop ordering from here.
author: Pat C.

description: Ordered a LARGE to-go pizza and was kind of disappointed on how small it was. The dough was really thin and the size was comparable to a medium pizza at dominos.  A little on the pricey side but their crust is damn good and so are their garlic knots which comes with marinara sauce.
author: Linz C.

description:
This review is for 4/21/12 visit.
My daughter and I had a long day and wanted pizza. We also wanted to try something new. We are so glad we decided to go to Firehouse pizza. It's connected to a grocery store so you can get your drinks there. 
Great staff n quick service. I had the Greek Pesto and it was amazing. Crispy crusts just the way I like it. My daughter had the Margherita.  That was awesome, too. We will definitely be going back. A definite must try!
author: Nerissa D.

description: I live less than three minutes away, yet it took an hour and forty five minutes to get my order. I called to check after an hour and a half. Upon arrival (15 minutes after my call), everything was cold and not that great. Pizza was cardboard-y and charred. Not pleased.
author: Ameigh F.

description:
"A new breed of pizza in SF" they say. Well, I guess if you mix a bunch breeds together, thereby diluting all the positives, yes it's a new breed. 

Probably one of the worst pizzas I've ever had in my life.

Room temp, stale, hard, bland, flat. Basically unappetizing. Those pictures you see with the nice fluffy crust and melted cheese? Yeah, I didn't get anything close to that.  

But we were famished, so what can you do?

Waiting over an hour for shite pizza is a first world crime. 

2 stars because I didn't find myself in the bathroom 30 minutes later.
author: Aren A.

description:
Used to love Firehouse Pizzeria. It's been my go to pizza delivery since it opened a few years back. Our last bunch of orders were either late or so-so quality. We wanted to give them a chance, in case they were flukes... 

But tonight the Italian pizza came with sliced carrots underneath the cheese and cauliflower on top. Now, I'm just confused! I didn't even think these ingredients were options.  If spotty and strange pizza is the new standard, no thanks.  Really wish that wasn't the case.
author: Desiree C.

description: Order veggie pizza and it was really yummy! Loved it. Wait time wasn't too much, even though it was weekend. Recommended!
author: Maulik S.

description: FIREHOUSE!!! Quit burning my pizza, couldn't be that hard to either turn the heat down on your oven or take the pizza out a little earlier, your pizza used to be great but 90% of the time it's burnt!
author: Shaunie M.

description:
Living in the Outter Richmond gives you a variety of many pizza places when you yelp what's around you! First of all I'm all about customer service, in person or on the phone! Bret, was the guy who answered the phone had the best customer service from a pizza place! I had many questions and he was so nice to answer all of it! Despite the fact I called twice because I was indecisive of what to order. Lol! 
Anyways I ordered a 12" inch supreme for 16.99. They told me it would take 45mins which it only took 30 mins! Pizza was still fresh and hot! Does it look like they skimp on toppings?!! Everybite had a topping,so so good! 
If you guys are wanting a delivery, it is a 15 minimum. Don't forget to ask for cheese and pepper because the delivery guy did not bring any, but it's fine... Who needs it when your pizza is just as good!
author: Janice B.

description:
Won't be coming back. Waited on a pizza that we ordered two and a half hours ago. We ordered the pizza online and my husband called right after to confirm they received the order; they confirmed they had it. 

Hour and fifteen minutes later we call to check on status, it's on the way they say. 

Half hour after that we call again and they say they never received the order. They tell us a manager will call us back.

Manager calls and was very patient and accommodating. Apparently the system didn't send them a ticket for the pizza (despite someone confirming they got it over the phone two hours ago). They're making us a pizza and will get it over to us first thing and it'll be free. The manager is the only reason I'm giving them three stars rather than one. He was super helpful and hand delivered the pizza but this is third issue we've had with the place (second time overly late and another time pizza was burnt)

Shame, good pizza but not coming back.
author: Caitlin B.

description:
I put in an order online for a pick-up at 6:00pm that day. I came in at 5:55pm and the pizza was hot and ready. I was in and out in one minute. I drove 30 minutes to a friends house and when we finally dug into the pizza, I was surprised! It was still really crispy and delicious! I got the Greek Pesto and added grilled chicken, yum!

I want to try some of the other flavors next time! The staff is friendly and super punctual. Two thumbs up!
author: Jenann P.

description: I heard good things about this place so I ordered a take out pizza. One half Italian & other half was plain cheese, to please both my kiddos' taste.  Is it normal to have long pieces of plastic string stuck inside the cheese pizza section? No I think not. Pizza wasn't that good. Any pizzeria that has plastic strings in their food should be reported to the health department. Big fat thumbs down Firehouse Pizza crew . I'm really sorry I gave you a big fat tip, will not ever be returning.
author: Mary P.

description:
We were in search of a Pizza place when we visited Golden Gate Bridge... This was the nearest and had decent reviews. One of the best Pizza joints I've been in recent times... Fresh and very non-chain (non Pizza Hut or dominos) taste. I would certainly go back when I am in the area.

And yes, make sure you try Spicy Bacon Cheeseburger Pizza...
author: Sathya P.

description: Excellent pizza especially when made by Seth. Definitely fresh ingredients and great service. I highly recommend their pizza and salads.
author: Dana Sue N.

description: 3 hours. Still no pizza! Called twice after we hit the hour 40 min mark and were told both times pizza was with the driver. We are 5 blocks away. Last call, 40 mins ago - same thing. Still no pizza.  eating leftovers now. Wish we did this three hours ago
author: shannon m.

description:
Burned a pizza and ***said*** they would put a comp in their system.  Comp wasn't there on a subsequent visit.  Lame.

10/30/15 - tonight's order:  showed up 30 mins after ordering as instructed.  Pizza wasn't even in the oven.  I'd take the one star back if I could.
author: Paul M.

description: So so good. Garlic knots were perfectly cooked and not too doughy with the perfect amout of fixings to.scoop up and dip into. Pizza was perfect too. Crust was not too crunchy but still thinner and the toppings were perfect. I dined in so everything was hot and fresh.
author: Jessica S.

description: Had the supreme xl with pesto sauce.  Full of vegy toppings and cheese; not so much meaty toppings.  Lacked flavor, but crispy crust.  Tight space and understaffed for level of business.
author: C T.

description:
It's a small location, but very popular! 

My fiancé has celiac disease and finding a good pizza place is always a struggle, but once we found Firehouse Pizzeria it's like our pizza prayers were answered! 

It's delicious, fresh & quick. 
We paid less than $20 for a gluten free 12in. with 3 toppings. Everyone is friendly and welcoming. 

I definitely recommend for anyone looking for a good regular and/or GF pizza
author: Maribel E.

description:
This use to be our go-to place for pizza.  The quality and level of service was great...but it's just gone downhill.  At first, it was the quality of the pizza.  Inconsistent is the best way to describe it.  One night you may get a pizza that's worth the price...order the same pizza the next night and you're left wondering what the heck is going on there.  Last straw has been extended times for delivery.  Tonight I ordered a pizza at 6:20PM.  It's now 9:20PM and I still haven't received our delivery. Three hours and no pizza.  I called an hour ago and was obviously given the runaround "It's headed out".  Guess what, it's not here and I live five minutes away.  At this point, I'll never order from here again.  

It's a shame...a couple of years ago I would rave to people about this place...now I'll be outspoken to have them avoid it.
author: Mike O.

description: Had terrible service here ordering for delivery, had called for a pizza a little after 8. Waited a little over and hour and my pizza still was not delivered, called again to hear my pizza still wasn't even in the oven, so I waited another 30 minutes for delivery, still no pizza. So I called again to talk to the manager, had been told the manager wasn't there and to call back at 10pm, even after that still no call from the manager, still no pizza, and almost waiting 2 1/2 hours. This place has terrible business and I will never order from here again
author: Audrey S.

description: Amazing pizza I really appreciate the amount of toppings they put on compared to most pizza places in SF.  I usually get the veggie combo or that plus meat.  It is very satisfying after a long day at work.
author: Courtney S.

description: Ordered the supreme pizza and it had no flavor what's so ever! We didn't finish it & usually I'll keep leftover pizza but I just threw this one away. We joked that digiorno (frozen pizza you get at store) was better lol but if I'm in San Fran again I don't think I'll come here again
author: Alonnie E.

description:
I moved to the neighborhood a couple of months back but recently tried out this place finally. 
We decided on the goad cheese pizza which comes with a white sauce. It was really fantastic. the crust was totally perfect and the cheese was just the right mix of cheeses so that the goat cheese wasn't overpowering or crumbly. I really look forward to trying their red sauce and their other pizzas.
I don't recommend eating there though; It's pretty much just a register and ovens inside, there's only a small counter with a couple of seats, and a couple of tables outside.
author: Lacy S.

description:
It is all my fault ------

My fault for ordering 2 Fingering delicious 6inch personal size BBQ chicken and supreme pizza.  I ate them all. 

Am mow exploded. Really, they are so good! Definitely coming back. Oh! Forget the waistline
author: Diana M.

description: Love the corn meal crust. I generally order the supreme as my go to. Close & convenient. Perfect little hole in the wall. Easy to find parking or pull up for pick up.
author: Thomas P.

description: I ate almost half on the way home.... They did not ask me what size i wanted so i said large expecting the largest one the had guess thats xL... Customer service in the phone and in person could use a adjustment. The will bot offer chili flakes or cheese or napkins on pick up. Woulda been pissed off more had it been delivered without...  They are hiring... Im not sure the pepperoni is a quality product.
author: Pedro Proz P.

description:
Great pizza, lots of choices and great prices.  We get to go.  I am always in-and-out the door in a jiffy -- but call ahead because they get busy and it may take up to 30 minutes for your order but it is well worth it.

Try the pesto pizza.  Always a winner in our house and it is attached to a grocery store so if you need beer or soda to go with your pizza, it is easy to pick up both in the same stop.

Two thumbs up!
author: Gary A.

description: Came to a friends house in the Richmond District to stay the night. We decided on pizza and he told me about this place. It's really tiny just pickup or delivery only, no dine in here. The employees are really chill you can tell they like their job, it seems like a cool place to work. The staff was really friendly. When we got home and opened the pizza my first thought was WOW! It looked just amazing. The cheese was nicely melted the toppings were all fresh the crust was just thick enough. The whole pizza complimented itself. I'd say this is probably one of the better pizza places I've eaten at in the city. I'll definitely eat here again when I can.
author: Krishna V.

description: Just ate there and it was amazing. Got the chicken club. The avocado was crazy good. Cheese was so yummy. I'm from LA and I'm going to come back here again.
author: Bryan P.

description:
Firehouse is the long awaited savior for quality-starved pizza enthusiasts in the Richmond district. 

The thin, crispy crusts are a joy to crunch down on as they dutifully uphold the pile of toppings that constantly threaten to infiltrate with grease. Although the crust is slightly burnt on the edges at times, the usually accompanying ashy overtone is minimal and not a noticeable detriment to taste.

The BBQ Chicken is highlighted by its carefully sweet and tangy sauce that does not grow wearisome with each passing bite. BBQ flavored pizzas elsewhere tend to gradually overwhelm the palate, clouding all other flavors. Firehouse's BBQ is consistently desirable, from whole pie to last bite.

The All Meat's star among plentiful candidates is the globular meatball that generously dots the pie landscape. Its meaty, firm texture provides distinction, whereas veggie-less pies elsewhere typically feature chunks of undifferentiable chunks of salty meat.

The largest pizza is only $23, but do note that it is smaller than XLs at other pizzerias. 

Unless you are willing to brave the chilling reign of Karl the Fog, be sure to order for pickup or delivery. There is only a four person counter inside and exposed, unlit seating around a few metal tables outside. If you have no other option, sit at the table closest to the heated vent, which will give temporary but likely, polluted relief from the San Francisco night.

There are also no drinks at Firehouse, but a convenient grocer neighbor should provide for your thirst.
author: Andrew M.

description: Be careful if you decide to eat in... the pizza comes right out of the oven and it's hot! Nearly burnt my finger when it got into the sauce. But aside from that... since pizza Orgasmica closed, I've been looking for a place to grab a small pizza pie. The toppings are fresh! I got a vegan cheese, jalapeños, garlic, sundried tomatoes and spinach. Some pizza places... dare i say use can jalapeños... gross. The crust is nice, thin and crispy. The cool dude behind the counter hooked me up with free garlic knots...which were yummy!
author: Peta C.

description:
Until Sunday before last, this was our favorite place to get pizza for parties and when friends visit. Everybody generally likes their combinations, even the vegetarians, and the crust is great (my priority). And, they are local, friendly and don't burn what they deliver, like Pizza Orgasmica.

But damn, last time will be the last time. The guy taking my order was an impatient jerk, but even that would be forgivable, as they were busy.

Too busy, it turns out, to notice the freaking short, curly hair on the top of my large Greek pizza. 

One of my guests noticed it, and refused to eat. Kinda ruined our poker party, as it would. 

Now we will have to go back to choosing either super-greasy Pizza Place on Noriega, or Pizza Orgasmica and enjoy the free charcoal topping.
author: Jill B.

description: Great neighborhood pizza joint, yummy thin crust, tasty toppings, friendly and fast service.  Called them for help feeding a house full of birthday guests today, and they made sure the birthday boy's pizza was just as he wanted it!  Pizza's arrived when we needed them, and everything we needed to eat em--  thanks so much.  Def will now be my go-to pizza place.   Pizza was delicious, no complaints whatsoever from anybody who had some.  I don't get the comments on the negative reviews-- there was no room for more toppings, the cheese went to the edges, the crust was crispy and cooked perfectly.  thank you again!!
author: A K.

description:
Let's be clear: this place occasionally makes a really good pizza (crispy, fresh & prompt)... but it's so. inconsistent that I think that today will be the last time I'll try it. 

Delivery took an hour and a half and the driver didn't even offer me my change before taking off. What I got was a cold pizza that had obviously been reheated in the box after the salami I had ordered had been forgotten then tossed on at the last second. The whole pizza tasted like the box itself. L

I want to give this place more stars. I do... it's been a solid four at times. ..

... But the last few times have been awful. So, if you want to roll the dice with your 20 bucks. Go ahead.

I won't be.
author: Jordan W.

description: We got the chicken club pizza and buffalo wings that came out in 15 minutes. Amazing! We definitely come back here. The crust on the pizza was perfectly crunchy.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Worst service ever!

I order a pizza at 11:30 this morning and was told it'd be ready within 30 minutes. Just in case they were running late, I walked over there at 12:15, giving them an additional 15 minutes.... They still hadn't made our pizza. We didn't even  receive an apology when we had to wait an additional 30 minutes. 


I will not go to Firehouse pizza ever again.
author: Jalahn W.

description: This taste like Totino's party pizza. I would have much rather had Digiorno, but I didn't know I was going to be choosing from that caliber when I ordered from a restaurant. Ours also had burnt crumbs all over the bottom like they never clean their oven. Add in the hefty price tag as the kicker and I'm pretty sure I wouldn't even go here if I lived next door.
author: David L.

description: Wow! I got pizza to go from here last week and I have to say that this was probably some of the best pizza I have ever eaten!  It took a while to get through on the phone because they were so busy around 9:30 PM but the wait was well worth it, we were rewarded with amazingly made pizza with the toppings going all the way out to the sides of the pizza, very tasty and deliciously made pizza for a very fair price! You will not be disappointed thank you for being great and taking pride in your product, it shows, thanks firehouse pizza!! :))
author: Lisa L.

description:
First of all, this place is a mess. I literally saw someone drop dough on the floor and pick it up and use it! Call me a clean freak but I also never saw any employees wash their hands! Gross! 

Pizza was very mediocre. The only thing I liked was that they have vegan cheese, but its super gooey and not very good. I had a slice and threw the rest of my pizza away. I also got a salad that I could've made better myself and for a lot less money. 

Nothing special about this place and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone!
author: Jade B.

description: A hidden gem in Richmond. Tiny inside but definitely not tiny in Taste and Service! They even have Vegan Mozzarella and Goat cheese for the Lactose adverse. We ordered the Garlic ties that you get free for checking in on yelp, and a Hawaiian 8" and a Goat Cheese with modifications in 10". Heads up, 8" is just right for one person. 10" if you're hangry. Will definitely make our way back to Richmond just to eat here. I read they deliver as well.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I've had better pizza in a highschool cafeteria. If this is the best the Richmond has to offer, go to another district. The pizza was dry and flavorless and they are really stingy with their toppings. It was a big disappointment. 

I got the spicy burger.
author: Marisa D.

description:
Maybe we just had a bad experience, but we came here because of the great reviews. Popped in, ordered at the counter and they said our two personal sized pizza and knots would be ready in 20 min. Walked around, came back. They said 10 more min...not a big deal. Came back again and they tried to give me the wrong order...then said 10 more min. Super annoying that a 20 min wait turned into 40. Not to mention they were messing around and laughing when I was clearly annoyed.

On the plus side the pizza and knots are good, so if I'm not expecting a quick bite we may be back.
author: Tracy B.

description: We ordered the margherita. I thought it was pretty terrible. Service was good, delivered locally within 40 minutes (less than the quoted time of 45). Shame about the pizza itself. Not a crust as such, more a flat fried base with thick cheese and a few scattered tomatoes and basil leaves. Oh, and it was cold. Won't return.
author: Danielle M.

description:
A new pizzeria in the outer richmond???  I love my hood but there are things that it lacks which include a good Pizzeria. Sure we have Gaspares, the pizza is ok but can be a bit too oily sometimes and the owner is really nice.  We also have Pizzetta 211 which can be considered as higher class pizza. Finally a solid good pizzeria has arrived: Firehouse has been opened for about 4wks now and are located on 22nd ave connected to the California market on the corner. This space is very small, it apparently was a meat locker before, with seating for about 4-5 people. Their pizza can be described as a thin cornmeal crust with a Chicago style toppings going on.  They are also currently waiting to get their liquor license...mmm beer and pizza

14" Spicy Bacon Cheeseburger- this pizza's got garlic butter, extra ground beef, jalapenos, bacon and cheddar. This pizza has heat! Loved it http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/13qxWkwMiflH0y48X949CA/l.jpg

Cheesy Bread- calzone looking bready and cheesy goodness http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UAJeOYR-8mIYZChA0DSSJA/l.jpg

Garlic Knots- Amazing knots of bready, buttery and garlicky goodness...two words F@#$king Amazing http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/f6p13mEh_vrVA-cZIkhJOQ/l.jpg

I actually ordered an Italian salad too but when i was there they had ran out or romaine hearts and practically everything to make me the salad. However they wrote me an IOU and gave me two salads of my choice because they felt really bad that they couldn't make me one then and then and there. Thanks Joe and Luke, You guys are awesome

I am really happy that we have a new pizzeria in the outer richmond and that the dudes running it are awesome. More importantly the pizza is good and i know i will be back for more garlic knots!! Keep up the good work dudes!
author: Jonathan W.

description: stopped in on a saturday at 1:10. was told it'll be a 20-25 minute wait for 2 pizzas. sounded reasonable, so we paid and waited. 2:00 came around and I asked if my order was ready. I was told that he was about to make them. 50 minutes and my order wasn't even made yet. I asked to cancel my order and he said that he didn't know how to do it, but he'd speak to the manager. there was only one guy working there and he was very overwhelmed. super polite guy, but I can't help but wonder who would staff a place with only one guy doing everything?
author: Jason C.

description: Really tried to like this place, ordered them several times. Last time I ordered delivery online - it took over two hours to get to my house and they messed up one or two things on my order. Called them to get a partial refund, they dicked me around and ignored me for a week. Manager finally called and offered a partial refund but never gave it to me. It's been a few weeks and still nothing from them. Such an aggravating experience for okay pizza, never ordering them again.
author: Lyndsie F.

description: Well, the pizza is still 5 stars and it seems like they've gotten their act together a little bit, at least that was my experience.   The pizza was ready exactly when they said it would be this time.
author: Charles W.

description:
First time I ordered from Firehouse, the food was pretty good.  The pizza was delicious (even a day later, cold, still pretty good).  I'd also ordered a salad which was good except for the dressing.   There were a couple of warning signs -- I tried to order in-store for take out and was told it would be over an hour, even though they didn't appear to be busy (sure enough, I called from home a few minutes later and they said it would be 15 minutes!)  Secondly, when I called in an order for a Cobb salad, they insisted that it was not on the menu, even though it is literally the first thing on the chalk board menu in the store.  The food was good, though, so I decided to come back again.

Second order, not so good.  The salad was terrible - wilted romaine lettuce, smashed grape tomatoes.  They forgot a couple of the toppings that were to be included in the mixed salad.  I tried a different dressing this time, and it was horrible too.   The pizza was also not good this time; in fact it was terrible, and I ended up throwing most of it away.  Crust did not seem like it was freshly made, weird taste and texture.  Sauce was really bland.  Toppings were not fresh.  My second order was placed at lunch time, 30 minutes after they opened for the day, so it was really disappointing that everything... tasted not fresh, like it had been sitting around all day.

Not sure I will be back again.
author: Heidi M.

description:
I should have written this update a long time ago. I have since had great experiences with Firehouse Pizza. Consistent product and awesome customer service including the owner himself re-delivering me a pizza when I received the wrong one. He also followed up with my personally after my last review which I was very impressed with. He made no excuses and just fixed things, which is all I really ever look for from a business because, let's face it: we're all human and mistakes can happen. 

My faves are buffalo chicken pizza, Hawaiian luau pizza, and the greek salad. Not a huge fan of the wings, but haven't tried other apps. 

Definitely my go-to place for pizza in the neighborhood!
author: Suganthi J.

description:
This place is our go-to for take out pizza in the Richmond/Seacliff area. We've tried lots but our favorite is the spicy italian one with peppers and salami. The margharita is a close second, and the pesto good too. 

It's well priced, quickly made, thin crust pizza that you can count on. As others have mentioned there is occasionally a consistency issue, but out of 40+ orders here, only 2 or 3 of our pizzas have been so-so; the rest were all great.
author: Laura J.

description:
Top five pizza in San Francisco. I know more about pizza than you, don't argue with me. I don't want to hear it.

This nondescript Little Pizzeria attached to a grocery store makes some of the best thin crust pizza I've had in this city in the past 4 months...  Great Garlic Knots as well.

Stopped in after walking by to grab a snack before we headed to the Park for a day of walking around. Im glad we discovered this place. 

Its not really a restaurant but they do have a counter you can eat your pizza at... or outdoor seating, if eating a pizza at 55 degrees is your thing.
author: Chad M.

description:
Their BBQ chicken pizza is the best I've had in the city! The other pizzas are pretty good too. The owner's daughter (I'm guessing) is adorable and loves to keep you company while you wait for your order. Extra points for that.

There's not really anywhere to stay and eat. This is simply a neighborhood hole-in-the wall pick-up and go kind of place. (The best kind in my opinion)
author: Brittany G.

description: Very meh pizza. Crust was mushy and limp. Really bad wings (like costco or something). Bleu cheese from a big institutional jug. Nice people there but food was a major letdown
author: David G.

description:
Open new years day!! Yay! 
Crust is thin and super crispy. Looks small at first but we found it was really filling. Fresh ingredients and given with a smile. Loved this place. Garlic knots are excellent and use fresh garlic.
author: Monica A.

description: Wanted pizza last night and instead of calling my favorite spot he called his old go to.... The Firehouse. They quoted us 50-60 minutes for delivery. Ok, that sounds fine. After the hour mark we called to check and they said it was out for delivery. 30 minutes later we get a call from them saying they will be here in 3 minutes. How do we not have the pizza yet if it was out for delivery 30 minutes ago? We live pretty close. Pizza came, pizza was cold. Way to much sauce, absolutely no crust. Over and hour and a half for gross pizza? From now on we call the pizza joint.
author: Gina B.

description:
Omnivore's advantage.

Michael Pollan's wrote about a dilemma: http://www.amazon.com/The-Omnivores-Dilemma-Natural-History/dp/1594132054

Firehouse has a solution: Vegan pizza featuring tomato sauce, vegan mozzarella, bell peppers, red onions and vegan burger crumbles.

Haven't read the former. Loved every bite of the latter. In fact regret getting the 6" $5.99 personal instead of the 10" $12.99 small. Wanted more.

There are plenty of carnivore friendly options to be found but it's the herbivores who are clearly the winners. Or perhaps omnivores like myself who enjoy everything.
author: Jason B.

description:
4.5 for the pizza
2 for the delivery service

Update: The owner Darryl messaged me and apologized for the late delivery.  I'll give them a go again since the pizza was tasty. :)

I ordered a large pizza that took approx. 90 mins to get delivered and was only lukewarm by the time I got it.  

I did called Firehouse at the 60 mins mark to see how my order was coming along.  I was assured over the phone that the delivery guy was "around the corner".  Once the pizza was delivered 90 mins after I placed the order I called Firehouse back, not to complain but, to give them a heads up that the pizza was lukewarm (at best).  Unfortunately, my call was met with some attitude.  I was asked if I wanted to return the pizza... ah, no... I didn't want to wait another 90 mins for dinner.  The bummer is I called to let them know the pizza was lukewarm, not to get something for free but, as a neighbor genuinely wanting to support local business.      

Highs: 
- Pizza was yummy

Lows:
- It took 90 mins to receive a lukewarm pizza.  I was told it would be a typical 60 mins.  Maybe pick-up is a better option for this place   
- Customer service wasn't great
author: Diane U.

description: This place is amazing. Had the Hawaiian lau. Food was great. The employees were really nice and hilarious. Will definitely come again.
author: Marvin V.

description:
Great pizza. Fresh toppings, crispy crust and fast delivery= warm on arrival.

Bonus- they do not skimp on the bacon topping.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Just called to order a pizza. First two times I  dialed, someone picked up and hang up the phone. Third time it rang for 5 min NO answer. 

They do have good pizzas and the manager reached out to let me know that they fix the issue with the phones.
author: Paul Z.

description:
I ordered the margarita pizza for delivery. They told me probably 1 hour to 1:15 for delivery but it arrived in about 45min! And, the pizza was delicious with its awesome thin crust and good, quality ingredients! 

I bet their other specialties are even better! (I tried to go "healthy" this night, hence the margarita pizza!) but still it was very, very delicious. 

Easy 5 stars!
author: Violet G.

description: Pizza that's good but not quite there. Even the most decked out of pizzas fall sort of vibrant or memorable flavors.
author: Danielle O.

description: Seth is awesome ! Great customer service and great pizza! All we need is great desserts! Preferably brownies'!
author: Jay D.

description: I ordered a Hawaiian pizza they brought me Hawaiian pizza with barbecue sauce is called the Hawaiian luau on their menu I didn't ask Hawaiian luau I asked for a Hawaiian pizza they told me next time I should read the menu
author: Allan Y.

description: Average pizza, average service. Nothing really that impressive about this place- wasn't bad, but nothing to rave about either. I felt it was expensive for really ok pizza. We also got a Greek Salad that came with ranch dressing which didn't really make sense to me. I would try another place in the neighborhood before going back.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
This is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. The pizza is very good, the chopped salad is delicious - and plentiful, and the service is very friendly. 

The veggie pizza is my new favorite order-in food for a foggy Sunday evening at home.
The owners are also proprietors of 6001 Market and they are happy to grab a bottle of wine or other misc. items from the store shelves and add it to your order - no outrageous restaurant mark-up! 

My only complaint would be that the buffalo wings were more than a bit fatty - although the sauce was nice.

Overall, Firehouse Pizza is a welcome new neighborhood amenity.
author: Carole B.

description:
Pesto sauce is very light and yummy. The pizza was great. It wasn't to heavy and greasy. I love how the next day the pizza was still good! When I heated it up, it still tasted pretty fresh and was not soggy from an over dose of grease.

To sum things up:
- decent priced ( I think 20 dollars for my pizza, It was enough to stuff my boyfriend and I )
- flavorful
- very light and not greasy.

Try it out!
author: Reiko n.

description: This place is delicious!! it's reallyyy small and connected to the next door little supermarket. It's a good place if u want to pick up some good pizza! I ordered the cheese burger pizza with jalapeños and the chicken club.
author: Jacqueline J.

description:
I'm writing this review for a Gluten & Dairy free pizza, the only pizza I've tried at Firehouse so far. 

The pizza left me wanting more. The gluten free crust was NOT good. It didn't taste like anything and was soggy by the time it got to my house. 
The vegan cheese was not tasty either. It didn't melt and you're better off with no cheese, trust me on this one. 
The rest of the ingredients were okay. I still think it only deserves 3 stars.
I think what really did it was the sauce. It reminded me of the pizza I got for lunch in elementary school, that was essentially a thawed and microwaved brick of tomato and cheese. 
Would my pizza have been better with regular crust & cheese? Maybe
Does firehouse need to rethink its tomato sauce recipe? I think yes.
author: Tania C.

description: Great pizza.  Cool people who work there.   A little weird ordering pizza but it was a Friday night. Thank you for being so great to us
author: Jill P.

description: One word "Gluten Free"....its hard enough finding gluten free options let alone great tasting options. Being gluten free for about 4.5 years now (not really by choice), this was a pretty decent place to pick up a pizza. Outdoor seating was great as we were on our way back home from baker beach with our dog and it was awesome eating pizza on a sunny day with my girlfriend and dog. My girlfriend says the regular (non-gluten free) pizza was good too. A little on the greasy side but no one eats pizza to be healthy!
author: Jose E.

description:
Why do the prices keep going up and the quality keep diminishing?
Why do the kids in the establishment always have attitude?

There are enough pizza joints in the Richmond that this place doesn't cut it. The Pizza is above average -- but not special. Read the reviews..... The only positive to this place is that "it delivers in my neighborhood" and the rest are people who accept the mediocre food that is the mainstay of Firehouse Pizzeria.

If you get the opportunity, skip Firehouse....Try Pizzetta 21 a block away for gourmet pizza, Pizza City, or Village Pizza.
author: Jay T.

description:
I should have believed the review that said this pizza tastes like dirt. No joke, it's true. Truly disappointed with the waste of money, I don't think a refund could even make me take this review down. 

Save your stomach and 20 bucks.
author: Mark C.

description: Worst pizza, worst customer service! 2 hr wait that I was told would be no longar than 40/60 minutes. Then when I called up 1 1/2 hr later I was told by the arrogant douche on the other end that I basically was lying that I wasn't given this time frame!! That everyone knows it at least a 2 hr wait for delivery....Sorry dude I've 4 kids waiting I would have went elsewhere.....Pizza finally arrives burnt and cold...gross
author: Rebecca D.

description:
Just when I thought my love affair with this place couldn't be any more torrid, I heard 5 words last night that solidified my scandalous ways:

'We will bring you beer'.

What what??

Followed with, 'or anything else you want, we have a full store!'

I tried not to sound too eager as I added a 6-pack of Modelo and a Virgil's root beer to my order, but my mind was racing with possibilities.  (I am out of limes, manbearpig used up the last of the TP, how am I going to shave tomorrow with no razors?). But I played it cool.  I don't know if this is standard offering, but Firehouse, you are getting hotter by the day.

And it's not just your oven.
author: Lea N.

description: the guy taking my order (I went in to order) forgot my garlic knots the second I said it, then forgot them again when he brought me my pizza. he was super unprofessional. garlic knots were more like butter knots. didnt taste any garlic on them. pizza was okay but had a sort of weird aftertaste. loved the crust tho, a bit crispy but not super thin. overall it was just okay.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Excellent! Get the vegan, gluten free pizza. If you can get past the embarrassment of ordering it, it's really tasty!
author: Heather M.

description:
I really hate to do this to a local place, but my fiance and I both agreed this was the worst pizza we have *ever* had. It's not hyperbole--it was really that awful.

The pizza was misshapen. It was severely undercooked (on half the pizza). The tomatoes were so bad I spit one out. As a result of the undercooking, the cheese was only partially melted and the crust was floppy and doughy. 

My fiance did say the delivery guy was nice so...I suppose it has that going for it. However, the guy that took the order was a jackass.

I will never order from here again, despite the lack of solid delivery options in the Outer Richmond.
author: Ethan R.

description:
The best gluten free pizza I've had yet!!!

*happy dance*
author: Theron L.

description:
Good service, good quality, fast delivery, but for some inexplicable reason it was a little light on the marinara sauce and perhaps that was why it lacked impactful flavor. Overall, I would order and happily consume again - I would just ask for extra sauce. We ordered the supreme pizza and thought the veggies were fresh, the sausage and pepperoni was of high quality and the crust was a perfect thickness. 
This is a gem in the neighborhood and it is a welcome addition to the Richmond!!!
author: Stacy T.

description:
Greco Romano used to be my favorite pizza joint in the Richmond District next to Giorgio's.  Ever since they left, it really hasn't been the same..............until now.  There are a lot of pizza parlors here but none that are good enough to go back to on a consistent basis.  I love the thin crust, the ingredients are fresh, and the service here was great.

I had the supreme pizza today.  It was great.  They are great salespeople as well telling me that I had to try their spicy bacon cheeseburger, the club, the hawaiin, and the buffalo wing pizza.  I said naw naw naw..........I can't eat that much.  They go it's ok............we'll do half and half for you next time.  hhahahahah

Look for Zac
author: jason g.

description: Since my first review, I have been contacted by the management team at Firehouse. They apologized multiple times and genuinely seemed upset that I had received such bad service. They explained what happened and what they were going to do to help fix the situation. They even thanked me for the feedback and gave me a free 16" pizza credit to use whenever I wanted. I reordered the same pizza but for pick up this time and it was good! Not my absolute favorite but I would definitely go back again. The crust could be a bit more sturdy but the flavors in the Hawaiian pizza are amazing! Hawaiian pizza with bacon and BBQ sauce! Yum! I would suggest this place to friends but only as a pick up until they can get the delivery down a bit better. :)
author: Brandi B.

description:
I am a New Yorker and the pizza here is one of the best i have ever had!

The specialty buffalo pizza with jalepiños is a must! Garlic knots are really good, I am not a big fan of the wings but pizza is awesome!
author: Jónatan P.

description: Very tasty thin and crispy crust pizza delivered in a timely manner to my home, despite it being a busy night due to some prize fight on TV. The bacon Mac and cheese was delicious too.
author: Marica C.

description: Only one way to put this. THERES SOME GOOD ASS FUCKING PIZZA HERE. Really some of the best pizza I've ever eaten. Was on a road trip to Frisco and was hungry so I saw this place and decided to give it a try and it was really good. 5 STARS.
author: Travis B.

description:
Read all the good reviews on yelp and decided to try it for myself.

Worst $15 I ever spent. The worst pizza I've ever had. Ordered a large pepperoni and, after one slice, ended up throwing it all away. Cheese tasted like plastic. Sauce had no taste. Very tasteless, bland pizza not to mention overly greasy. 

Very disappointed. Will not be coming back.
author: Sonia R.

description: 3 stars just for offering vegan pizza. Complete with daiya and vegan burger crumbles! I hate to write such a review for a place so accommodating to vegans...but this pizza was so disappointing. Not sure why a vegan pizza gets HALF the cheese a regular cow's milk pizza would have. It was all sauce, with a couple cheez shreds. I've had amazing vegan pizza with the same ingredients at other places, this place just missed the mark. Forgettable, bland, lacking freshness.
author: Jane R.

description:
The first time I went to Firehouse Pizza I had a hard time finding the door.  I swear, it was intimidating because I was literally 2-hours-lived in San Francisco and not used to the neighborhood markets and back-of-the-house businesses, but I am so happy I finally found it!

I have gotten both cheese pizza and buffalo chicken pizza and let me tell you, they were both amazing!  The crust is this awesome in-between of thin and thick crust, and is garlicky and amazing.  Cheese and sauce is legit.  My pizza has been ready for pickup as soon as I walk over and the kids working at the register are always sweet.  In addition, I LOVE the market Firehouse is attached to and enjoy perusing for wine or some dessert while I wait for my pizza.  

I love this place and am so glad to have it in the neighborhood!

I just wish they were open late-night... although that would probably be bad for me......
author: Sara W.

description: We are really psyched about our thin crust supreme pizza!  We met the owner and people who work here!   Awesome for take-out or delivery, but you can eat here!  Our pizza was awesome so will be back!
author: Gary Z.

description:
Had a craving for pizza - wanted delivery. 

Firehouse Pizzeria did not disappoint: Ordered a 12" (about a medium) size pizza: Half Goat Cheese (Garlic butter, spinach, crumbled goat cheese, mozzarella, mushrooms, and grape tomatoes) and half Italian (Olive oil, giardiniera peppers, mozzarella, mushrooms, smoked ham, genoa salami, and grape tomatoes). The price of the pizza on Firehouse's website for a 12" is $16.99, but my bill for the pizza totaled $19.95 - tax? a delivery charge?

The Goat Cheese was absolutely splendid - but then again goat cheese is never a miss on Pizza (Yes, I did capitalize Pizza). I didn't taste the garlic butter or spinach, but the grape tomatoes were delicious - Fresh, and really added to the rest of the vegetarian toppings. Definitely would recommend this flavor - will order this again on my next Firehouse Pizzeria delivery. The Italian was a bit of a disappointment - very salty, even after pulling off the salami pieces (not a fan of salami). The toppings on the Italian were very scarce, and the mushrooms, smoked ham, and scant amount of grape tomatoes were bland. The thing that saved this style of pizza was the topping of giardiniera peppers - salty, crunchy, and with the barest hint of heat - dee-li-cious.

On my next order to Firehouse Pizzeria, I will be ordering the Goat Cheese again, and the Veggie Supreme with the additional topping of the giardiniera peppers.

Until next time, Firehouse Pizzeria.
author: Vicky T.

description: Living in the Richmond District it's pretty difficult to find good pizza. There's Gaspares but the wait is always ridiculously long and I have absolutely zero patience.. Oh and then theres Dominos, Blahhhh! So after driving by this place a few times, I decided to give it a go. I ordered for Delivery. The man on the phone was extremely kind and the pizza got her quickly and was as delicious as everrrrr. Definitely recommend if you're a local staying in on a Saturday night.
author: Gabrielle Z.

description: The pizza is good here. Service is fast and friendly. Kids love it. We have them deliver to the park too!
author: CR L.

description: There are some places that seem to not want to be in business. Well, they like the side of the transaction where they receive your money. Providing their side of the deal - not so much... Or they are simply so inept that they shouldn't have an "open for business" sign. Or worse, they simply don't care. With Firehouse, I lean towards the latter. They simply don't appear to care. They don't care about quality, service, their reputation, anything. We like to support local businesses, so we've given this place chance after chance after chance. And they've repeatedly slapped us in the face with terrible delivery times (exceeding 90 minutes), burnt crusts, missing toppings (including tomato sauce - seriously), under-cooked product, and destroyed deliveries (the pizza folded into a ball of mush all in one corner of the box - and they had the audacity to try pass it over to us). There is no respect here, and for the price it's insulting. I'd like to say, "It's not you, it's us," but it is YOU.
author: Billy B.

description:
The pizza was great for a neighborhood pizzeria... we had it straight from the oven and ate it at the little counter in the back! You can buy drinks from the adjacent small market next door. Cool little setup! They have tons of magazines to read from, too, while waiting or eating.

Make sure to try the garlic knots! YUM!

My favorite part, however, was listening to the staff interact with each other while going about their jobs. Such a chill group. I would go back just to listen to them haha.
author: Eunice K.

description:
My best pizza in the city is still Arinell Pizza on Valencia St.

Pizza Joint is better. 
Seniore's Pizza is better.
Victoria's Pizza on Balboa, the most ugly pizza parlor, is better.
Escape From New York Pizza is better.
Victor's Pizza on Polk better.
Amici's is better.
Even I like Gaspare's Pizza House on Geary is better than this.

Tonny's Pizza is definitely better.
Tommaso Ristorante Italiano is better
Pizzeria Picco is better.
Za Gourmet Pizza is better.
Pizzeria Delfina is better.
 
Yes, I am a jackass.
I always compare a pizza with some place else.

It's on 22nd
I looked for the place for a while.
It is very tiny, I like a place like this.

Its the absolute perfect thing that this neighborhood needed. 
I came here twice.
I like the sweet/tangy pizza sauce but the crust. 
The crust is I was expecting better, tasted like a Domino kind.
I wanted to like the place so badly but the crust.

I am going to try Firehouse Pizza again soon. I may be disapointed to learn that the world does not revolve around me and nothing has changed.  But I can hope.  Stay tuned for updates!
author: Nobu K.

description:
I ordered a pizza from this place practically the first few days they opened.  The owner picked up the phone, spoke to me about his travel from the East Coast to the West Coast.  It is the quintessential small business story.  

I told him to put together a pizza for me.  I told him to choose the ingredients as he saw fit.  I told him to surprise me.  About a 40 minutes later, he showed up to my house.  He personally delivered a chicken, bacon, tomato, bbq sauce, and cheese pizza.  

I tell you, I haven't had a pizza like that since the days I worked at Lococo's in Terra Linda.  Maybe it's not so much the food but the people that make the food.  Let's keep this small business prosperous.  Let's keep this owner on the West Coast.
author: Mo H.
