description: Tried the chicken club. Pretty good considering the unusual toppings. Definitely would try again. I originally thought it had a pick-up location and a dining location but it's only pick-up or delivery. There is a small place for like 4-5 people to eat a slice though.
author: Mellisa A.

description: I think this is pretty solid stuff, no problems! Delivery is quick, it's affordably priced, sauce has zest. For the outer rich, this is more than a solid deal, it scrumptious. They are also connected to a store that has tons of drinks and snacks etc.
author: Amol S.

description: I love Firehouse! Their gluten-free pizza is delicious AND well-priced. (If you're gf, you know what I'm talking about...) The staff is always incredibly friendly and the delivery is fast. I'm so glad they're in my neighborhood.
author: Terry C.

description:
Forced my boyfriend to move to the Rich from Downtown . . . 

4 words.  THANK YOU FIREHOUSE PIZZERIA!!!!!!!!!!!

He found this gem while I was having a girl's weekend at Spring Training in Arizona so while I indulged in the 2012 World Champions he indulged in a BBQ Chicken
BBQ sauce, oven-roasted chicken, mozzarella, red onion, cheddar, and smoked bacon pizza.

Such a nice guy he even left me a slice for when I got home from the airport.  WOW.  Now we get to indulge together as we ordered the same pie the very next day.

20 min delivery. SWEET.  Amazing pizza. CHECK.   Located in the Rich? YES.

THANK YOU!!!!!!!! :) :) :)
author: Jenny B.

description: Delivery took over 2 hours to arrive. Called in 3-4 times and the guy on the other line kept providing bogus estimates @ the 1 hour mark "driver is almost there" @ the 1.5 hour mark "he will be there in 15 min" @ the 2 hour mark "he will be there in 3 min". Official time was 2 hours and 15 min. Delivery guy expressed how frustrated he was with management, that a driver already quit tonight, and that he too planned to quit. Pizza taste did meet my expectation ( that it was cooked over 2 hours ago). This place needs to figure it out, until then, there's a bunch of other pizza options in the area I'll try next time. Don't see myself ever coming back to this dump.
author: Marcus C.

description: I ordered a pizza and garlic knots because of the ravishing reviews this pizzeria has earned. However, I am disgusted by how poor this restautant handled our service. When I called in for a delivery I was told it would be here anywhere from 45 minutes to an hour. Well it's been over 2 hours and they haven't made their delivery yet. When I called the restaurant an hour and a half after ordering, they said their driver was running late and was on his way and should be here within the next couple of minutes. I am so disappointed with this place because all of the reviews had boasted about how great their food was. Unfortunately, that is not the case. I hope I was an unlucky costumer because I will never again waste my time or money at this place again.
author: Mathias S.

description:
Located on the same block as my elementary school, Alamo, Firehouse pizza offers a lot what you would expect from a pizzaria, made by Connecticut native Luke, John, and other staff.  Jon W. and I were craving something quick and delicious after hitting the gym, so we decided to try out this new place.

The restaurant looks like it's connected to the Market on the corner and there was only 1 long table to eat at, and not much space left over if you wanted to eat there.  We were greeted by Luke, who was very nice and welcoming.  He gave us the lowdown what their focus is, which was to bring Connecticut style pizza with Chicago amounts of toppings.  Jon W. and I agreed on getting a Spicy bacon cheeseburger, which had Bacon (which makes everything better), jalapenos, ground beef, and cheddar, and a salad, and not long after we placed our order, Joe (or was it Luke?) informed us that they ran out of Salad, as well as a topping or two and asked us if it was ok to substitute the missing pizza topping for something else.  We ended up ordering breadsticks, and they offered garlic knots on the house, as well as 2 vouchers for a free Salad on our next visit.

They felt really bad that they couldn't fulfill our order, and I felt they made up for it, and then some.  Now, onto the good stuff: FOOD.  The pizza was amazing, and so were their garlic knots.  As with most foods, it was best enjoyed white hot, as the garlic buttery flavors explode with each bite, and the pizza was simply delicious.  The first thing that hit me after the initial bite was the cheese.  I swear, it tasted like they just broke open the packaging of it just for our pizza: it was so fresh and yummy.  The rest of the toppings were cooked well, seasoned well, and were abundant.  The crust was crisp and wasn't too airy or dense, and the pizza overall wasn't too greasy, as with the bread sticks and the garlic knots.

Having it located near my elementary school, which is also close to my work makes it ideal for a quick and convenient spot if I ever crave pizza or yummy garlic snacks.  Luke and Joe were both awesome and really earned my stamp of approval, which doesn't really exist, but if I could design one, it'd be like the ones Chinese artists use to finalize each piece of work, using an ivory stone dipped in red ink, with my chinese name and a big thumbs up carved into it.
author: Hube N.

description:
I've only gotten delivery from here, but every pizza has been hot and delicious. They have all the traditional flavors as well as some of the more exotic combos.

 And the delivery guy seems to be genuinely happy to bring me pizza compared to the typically moody guys that seem on the verge of suicide.
author: Nik D.

description:
Good stuff! Definitely fills those pizza cravings!

We always order delivery and the service is always timely and the pizza always arrives hot. What more could you ask for?

Our favorites are the goat cheese and the supreme...mmm :)
author: Kristy R.

description:
Is it just me or do these pizzas never come with sauce?

This is my second time eating here, and while these pizzas do have some potential, I find them dry and overall - unappetizing.

The two stars are for the awesome service and the wings - some pretty tasty wings. But, they didn't come with Ranch or Bleu Cheese like advertised.

No hard feelings guys, but I now have concluded that I would much rather spend $15 on a pizza at Pizzetta 211 and know exactly what to expect.
author: Briana C.

description:
The pizza tastes just fine, good even but they can't seem to get it to my mouth.  We ordered at 12:05 on a Saturday afternoon for a 3 yr old's birthday party, they said 45 min.  Called after 1.5 hours and was told the pizza was in the delivery car and would be there soon.  Called after 2 hours and told the exact same thing.  It was finally delivered after 2.5 hours, which is 1 hour and 45 min late.  They also forgot to deliver the drinks we ordered.

Don't worry 3 year olds are really good at waiting almost 3 hours for a meal...their parents too.

So there you have it, fine pizza, their ability to deliver it in a timely fashion is atrocious.
author: Jeff Z.

description:
We just ordered from here for pick up, so in anticipation for the deliciousness we're about to om nom nom on, I decided to write a quick review. 

The people who work here are so friendly! The first time we ate here, I had my Frenchy with me. They were so excited and greeted my dog, my boyfriend and myself warmly. 

We shopped at the attached market while we waited and the staff there we're great as well and gave Reggie (my frenchy) a little treat. The food was ready quickly and the pizza was delish. 

The second time we went we got Garlic Knots. SOLD! The staff chatted with us while we waited, again, super friendly service. You MUST try these. I'm drooling just thinking about them. OMGISITTIMETOGOPICKUPYET??
author: Heather E.

description:
These guys just saved us thousands of dollars. We were ready to pack up and leave the Outer Richmond due to it's lack of good pizza. Worst yet, the best of delivery options were terrified to drive into the fog.

I noticed this unassuming little place the last time I bought groceries at 6001 Market (the place they share real estate with). I thought these guys are ballsy opening a pizza place a block away from the gourmet favorite Pizzetta! As for me, I like Pizzetta but I was looking for that pizza that you can have with beer and re-heat later.

Firehouse delivered! We ordered the supreme and it was evenly layered with amounts of pepperoni and delicious sausage. The vegetables were still crunchy and not over cooked. We did the wax paper (the sheet under the pizza) test and were astonished that it was bone dry! At first bite the crunch of the crust reverberated through our apartment...perfect! As for the sauce, it was sweet and tangy in equal amounts with excellent body. It complimented everything rather than detracted like most pizzeria sauces.

As a special side note to this review I NEED to give a shout out to Firehouse's wedge salad. Sabrina is always ruining a great pizza night with the addition of a salad and I thought this night was to be no different. I was completely wrong! the wedge salad was excellent and I felt good about getting my veggies.

Lastly, the customer service was some of the best we've experienced in a while from phone call to pick up. These guys were friendly and professional throughout!
author: Vince and sabrina B.

description: We tried this place on December 30, it was the closest place where i was staying.  The Pizza is good, they have lot´s of sizes and you can build your pizza.  Practical, fast service, something nice?  it was open on december 30 and 31!!  there was another pizzerias close that we tried earlier and they were closed!!   By the way, the people is nice and funny!!
author: Francisco M.

description:
Had delivery today...pizza dough was under cooked. But customer service was awesome!!! Refunded our order a plus even offered o send an extra pizza but was too late..
Look forward to the next order.......
author: Johnny C.

description: This is my go-to for pizza delivery in outer Richmond. Service is friendly, and the delivery people willingly walk it all the way up to my door. Really great pizza, too.
author: Diana R.

description: This was the best pizza i had in San Francisco. I was living in the Richmond, was late and i was hungry and wanted to eat pizza. I Yelp some options and i was lucky to choose this pizzeria. ive oreder a couple of times and i always loved it. The delivery was fast, the pizza was still hot....was great
author: Danielle S.

description:
I will bump my rating up to 5 stars in a heartbeat if Firehouse Pizza switches to a different pizza sauce and improves their salad dressing (the Ranch in particular).  

Everything else is divine!!  Firehouse Pizza will be a neighborhood staple in no time, its the absolute perfect thing that the area needed.  And it does sound like some people like the sweet/tangy pizza sauce but it doesn't suit our taste.  But everything else is great, crust, cheese, toppings, cheesy bread (mmm!) , salad - everything was good.  But we disliked the sauce and the salad dressing enough to slink back to our usual pizza delivery standby.  But we do not want to.  We want Firehouse Pizza to be our go-to!

We are going to try Firehouse Pizza again in a week or two.  I may be disapointed to learn that the world does not revolve around me and nothing has changed.  But I can hope.  Stay tuned for updates!
author: Holly L.

description: I find every time it's raining I would have firehouse pizza, delivered. Pretty good pizza overall. But the last time I tried Italian pizza, it's very very dry. Not very tasty. Both my son and I agreed that we won't order Italian flavor again. Otherwise, good pizza for the neighborhood. Not cheap though.
author: madeline m.

description: Ok pizza. But I thought the service was good which helped them a lot. We ordered the supreme 14 inch. The pizza could have been better but I'm not complaining. Hope to come again to update my review.
author: Jason L.

description:
Awesome neighborhood pizzeria. We're in the Richmond district, and I was happily surprised to find a great pizzeria withing driving distance. We did a half Pepperoni (for our daughter) and half Spicy Bacon Cheeseburger specialty pizza and both were excellent. The Spicy Bacon Cheeseburger had just the right amount of heat to it, not overpowering. Our plates ended up a little greasy, but that's about it.

Also had their wedge salad to our dinner. Can you say, REAL smoked bacon? YUP! None of that fake hard tiny bits of "bacon" here...at Firehouse Pizzeria, its the real deal!

For drinks, they have a neighborhood market connected to them, so you have your selection from an entire cooler full. Prices are market, but still, there is sure to be something to accommodate all tastes, not just your usual soda fountain choices.

The counter sits 5 stools and are 3 tables of four outside. Customer service rocks as well. Definitely guys that love what they do, not just in it for the job.

For our pizza deliveries from now on, its "Bye bye North Beach Pizza...hello Firehouse Pizzeria!"
author: Mark M.

description: Love the pizza and the service.  They're a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Zoran L.

description:
12/09/11    


I noticed this place by accident as I headed to the bustop. There were 3 people standing outside which attracted my attention. They were hanging around the side of the building.

The main entrance is located on side  of a storefront and away from the front of the store. I noticed above the doorway was a small banner :

       NOW OPEN
            PIZZA
         221-7603

I stepped inside. I was told today was the grand opening. 
I ordered the almost simpliest one and used as a benchmark. 
They were generous with the topping. The over piled it like one would make an 
         apple pie, knowing that it would flatten out when baked.

The place was spartian. They built it inside the 6001 California grocery store.
Located back left side of the building with two mini rooms. One to build the dough.
The other multipurpose room:   prep area
                                                         pizza oven
                                                         cashier desk
                                                         narrow ledge with stools for dining.
You could enter the grocery store from there also.


I ordered a 6 incher, personal size togo.

The crust was beautifully baked that it had a deep crunch.
The generous amount of cheese, fresh garlic, sweet cherry totmatoes.


TIP about grand opening (New Places)
      
       PRO:         
                        ALL fresh ingredients
                        Clean tables & utensels
                        Clean bathroom for the time being

       CON:       Green waitstaff (not true all the time)
                        Prep time not at optimal yet (practice makes good)



Been more than 100 different places in the Bay Area. 
This place so far is up there.

Simple menu for a simple place. They say they will have slice(s)
          in the future.


Review not finished ... going there for second try... in a few hour...
         more to post
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Firehouse: what happened?! Consistency is best business practice, and proper recruiting and training are key tools to achieve that success. The pizza had been pretty decent for the past 6 months and we placed orders (almost) weekly to my house, but it's obvious there have been some new hires handling the pizzas without the proper training.

My most recent pizza this week was completely inconsistent with others I've had...not cooked right, too little sauce, very few toppings, and triple the amount of cheese. 

I certainly hope this make-shift pizza joint can figure it out. I'll have to give them some time to let the waves settle...
author: Matt D.

description: Garlic knots are so yummy!!! Our favorite by far is the margarita pizza. Lucky for us it is right near our home and they also deliver... Will be ordering from here again.. To bad there is not enough seats in house to enjoy there..
author: Das M.

description:
So, after trying a couple of times, I'll give it a solid 2 and a half stars (rounded up to 3). The pizza itself is OK--not too bad. It's more of a gourmet style of pizza rather than an East coast style of pizza. The ingredients are fresh, which gives it a big boost. But the rest of it is meh. The "wedge salad" is actually just a bunch of chopped romaine with a little bit of bacon and blue cheese. No wedges to be seen. And the garlic knots, which I was so excited about, were burnt the first time I ordered them and slightly underbaked the second time. 

I'll stick with Amicis or Georgio's for my pizza cravings.
author: Amy B.

description:
So in a continued effort to find a good pizza place in the Richmond, I decided to try Firehouse Pizza last night. It was...okay. I want this place to succeed so I'm going to write review containing "constructive criticism" as opposed to my usual "don't waste your time" rant. I hope the owner reads these...they should.

The good stuff first. 
1. Great customer service - the kids working there are very courteous and nice. Rare really.
2. Close to my place - big points
3. It's attached to one of my favorite little neighborhood markets. Grab some good affordable wine while you wait for your pizza. 
3. Garlic knots were awesome! Very salty, garlicky, and delightfully crusty on the outside but doughy and soft on the inside. Perfect with some ranch dressing. These were so good in fact that I ate the left overs for breakfast this morning. 
4. Now for the pizza.. Nice thin crust (not too heavy) and crisp, great size options, great prices, and a really nice selection of sauces and toppings. 

Now the reason I only gave 3 stars. There really aren't a lot of things wrong, just one main thing that will keep me from going back. Drum roll please.... The Marinara Sauce. No bueno. Bland and flavorless. I found myself sprinkling salt on my pizza and I've never, ever had to do that. And that didn't even help, so I didn't eat any more of it. 2 slices was all I could manage and I got a small so the slices are tiny. The sauce is the base of the entire pizza, if it's bland and flavorless...so is the pizza. 

So my recommendation is for the owner or pizza maker is to work on the sauce and I will consider coming back for another try. A little salt goes a long way people.. Oh one other thing, I ordered garlic on my pizza and didn't taste it all. Possibly they just forgot to put it on, but if that's not the case, they need to up the portion b/c I got nothin...
author: Brenna S.

description: An expert pizza reviewer who always orders the same thing from different places--our 9-year-old grandson--says the pesto pizza is "the best pizza he has had in his whole life"!  Adults had the vegetarian pizza with great veggie selection.  Pizza was ready for pickup in 25 minutes.  They called us saying it was ready earlier than the 30 min. they quoted.  Fastest I've ever seen!  Take out only.  They also deliver.  5 stars for fine pizza, good prices and fast service.
author: Nancy S.

description: My go-to for pizza in the Outer Richmond. It can get busy on the weekends, but the food is always hot. In fact, there's a nice spice to their sauces. I've also become a fan of their cheesy bread! Tends to run cheaper than other nearby options.
author: Tim W.

description:
I have searched far and wide, high and low, for a pie that can satisfy my craving for my favorite place back home. IT'S A BINGO! Crispy thin crust that is slightly fluffy/chewy on the top. The cornmeal makes it. We had a half and half with the Spicy Cheeseburger on one Half and Hawaiian on the other. I have to admit, bbq sauce on pizza is not my fav and only tried the cheeseburger as a strategic negotiation in order to get my pineapple/pizza fix. I gotta say, the bbq sauce is genius. It totally marries the savory/sweet combo PLUS they add bacon-it really does make everything better. The cheeseburger is REALLY good too, and that means a lot coming from me. We also got the chopped salad and the lettuce, tomato, and avocado were perfectly ripe and fresh. YUM. 

Service...really nice people and I'm assuming family owned. I think it adds to the charm even if things aren't exactly perfect (referencing the haters!) My order was ready in 15 min and I was able to pick up a few things from the German grocery next door. Two birds, one stone.
author: Nitalia P.

description:
Ate at Firehouse Pizzeria 3 times within 4 months. 

I have only ordered (to-go) the Spicy Bacon Cheeseburger Pizza. Why venture off and be disappointed with another pizza combo when this one is already a winner?! Garlic knots are notable as well.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Fast, friendly service, and hands down the best pizza I have had in San Francisco!  Maybe even the world! 

I love some heat on my pizza so I am obsessed with Firehouse's Spicy Bacon Cheeseburger, they put garlic butter on the crust of this and their Goat Cheese pizza and it's pretty much the best thing I have ever eaten!  

If you're lucky enough to be in their delivery zone, order from them now, you won't regret it!!
author: Jessica K.

description: I love ordering from here, by the time it gets to my house it's still fresh . It's not soggy, and it's sooo good! 5 star!
author: Valerie R.

description:
Love their Margherita pizza! The best one I've had so far.

I work about a mile away from their location so it's also great to know that they deliver.
author: Jen F.

description: This place has amazing Gluten Free pizza!
author: Chris H.

description:
OMG!!!!  I love, love LOVE this pizzeria!  I've had the pizza AND garlic knots multiple times here within the last few months and they have not failed me since.  It's kind of sad though that my BF and I are just discovering this tiny place when we might be moving out of the area.  No doubt though, we'll be coming back for more each visit to the city.

I definitely recommend the garlic knots!!!  They're out of this world and made with REAL fresh garlic.  They better be since they're in the back of a grocery store.  And their spicy hamburger pizza is fantastic!!  Everything is fresh and the guys cooking and ordering in the back are real nice!  However, I would only recommend take out or quick bite eatery.  The place is small and only seats about 4, but I like enjoying my pizza at home on the couch anyway!
author: Holly L.

description: I really like the pizza here for the price. The toppings were a little sparse when I ordered last, even compared to the other pictures here, but the ingredients are quality and there's a good selection of specials to satisfy most people. It's on my list of places for pizza delivery, just not the short list.
author: George P.

description:
Pizza rocks.  Good crust.  Love the sauce.  
Daryl rocks.  He promises me that he'll have 'slices' of pizza tomorrow at 12:15 pm.
author: Geri S.

description: Ordered delivery from this place last night.  I ordered a gluten-free pepperoni pizza.  They arrived in a short amount of time, the delivery woman was nice, and the pizza was surprisingly good.  The crust was crispy, (I asked for extra crispy) the cheese was gooey and the pizza didn't have any soggy spots. It arrived pretty hot, which delivery tends not to be. My husband ordered a pizza too, not gluten-free, and he liked his too.  This was also a surprise.  We will definitely order from here again.
author: Heather S.

description: Needed a late-night dinner after a long day, and my gf and I stumbled across Firehouse. Tiny little spot, but they are attached to the store on the corner, so they can apparently bring you drinks and booze and what not if you order that. Unfortunately, the store closes around 8, so don't expect beverages with your order after that. Cool crew who delivers and makes the pizza fast, but the quality of the pizza itself was probably a 6/10 for me. That being said, I'd highly recommend the garlic knots! Overall, pretty solid. This is more like a 3.5-star review. Would be 4 if they didn't make me drink tap water with my pizza!
author: Jeremy D.

description:
This place is great! Every time I call for delivery they are very helpful and willing to answer my questions. They deliver promptly, and everything always tastes great! 
I get the gluten free 19 inch with anchovies and it is amazing. Perfect for a night at home.
author: Laura P.

description: Extremely friendly service, despite how busy it gets around dinner time.  We got a large pizza, half plain and half mushroom.  Flavors are fine.  A bit too garlicky for my taste.  There isn't really a place to sit aside from the seats outside, so calling ahead for pick up or get delivery may be a better option.
author: Candice B.

description: I have been going to Firehouse Pizzeria for the past 6 months and I have to say that the whole time I have gone there with friends and family; I have not been disappointed. Their ingredients are fresh, there sauce isn't too overbearing and the crust is just right. Best pizza in Outer Richmond hands down.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I ordered a pizza for delivery as a study break treat and wow, was I surprised! 

I ordered the goat cheese pizza and it just might have been the best thin slice pizza I've had in SF to date.  

Reasonable price and under 40 min. delivery. 
I will definitely be ordering again!
author: Xandra M.

description: Had the chicken club a few nights ago. Really enjoyed it. Loved the flavors and the crust was perfect. Defiantly will be ordering from here again.
author: Satoshi K.

description: Hey Firehouse Pizza, Why don't you take 40 bucks and fix your phone.  Your pizza is pretty decent, but every time I call I get some guy who hears the first part of my call and then a bunch of hello?s before he hangs up.  My phone works just fine when I call another delivery place.  For your Pizza you get 4 stars, but for the guy who pretends he can't hear because he doesn't want to deliver to the admittedly farther reaches of your delivery map you get zero stars.  If you don't want to deliver that far, adjust your map.
author: Hann A.

description: WORST Pizza ever!! sauce is like dirt, the crust is undercooked pillsbury doughboy yeasty nastiness, and the cheese, is that even made with dairy products or is it velveeta. was delivered on time in the 35 min promised, but this thing was nasty nasty nasty. we tossed it and ate ramen for dinner. the salad was not much better, the cucumbers were slimy and partially translucent, the avocado was sad and brown mush. the garlic knots were garlicky and the only edible thing in the order. Don't do it! save yourselves and your money! ickkkkkk.....
author: b p.

description: The BBQ chicken pizza is our favorite and has great flavor. We also always order the garlic knots which are soft and just the right amount of garlic. We usually pick up our order since delivery takes so long and we only live a few blocks away. But overall a good neighborhood pizza place.
author: Kristin K.

description: Ok, so I came here because of the great reviews and the mouth-watering pizza pics. I've been gawking at various restaurants on Yelp as I'm currently on a staycation and wanted to try some local eats. Fireside Pizzeria was one of those places. I finally got there the moment they opened and placed my order of a 12" Supreme pizza. I patiently waited for 30 minutes and killed time by scrolling through the hunger-inducing pizza pics. After what seemed like an eternity, I peeled myself off my car seat and sprinted the 20 meters to the pizza place, the young man behind the counter was courteous and was slicing my pizza as I rolled right in. It looked delicious enough for me to devour right then and there. The pizza, that is, not the young man. Anyhoo, I paid for my $19 pizza, and sat my a** down at their outside seating area and dug right in. The appeal factor, well, it wasn't. It looked nowhere as gorgeous as the pics y'all been putting up and it was made with RED bell peppers, not the GREEN ones! Yet, I was hungry and my stomach was about to digest itself if I didn't shove  a slice of pizza down my throat. The first bite, tasted rotton, like  a moldy piece of bread drenched in detergent. I didn't think much of it at first as I was ravenous. The second slice tasted moldy-detergent as well. Then I tried a third slice: DITTO moldy-detergent taste! What gives?! I theorized I got a moldy pizza dough that got rolled with the young man's freshly laundered hands. Sigh, maybe, I shouldn't have been the first customer to order. Maybe the young man should've rinsed his hands more thouroghly and used fresh dough. Maybe, I should've just read the bad reviews. Maybe, I should stop looking at these damn pizza pics...
author: Anna D.

description: Called at 12:30pm and was told deliveries start at 11:30am but he couldnt take my order until he asks his manager. He said he will at least write it on a piece of paper and have his manager call me. His manager then calls me back 10 minutes later to quote a price. They told me 30 minutes from the original call. It has now been an hour and a half. Keep in mind this is for a salad and chicken wings. This guy is getting $1 tip and no more business from us.
author: Tommy P.

description:
i was just lamenting the perennial lack of solid, "pure" pizza places here in the richmond, when my wife mentioned that a new pizza place just opened on 22nd ave. the next night we checked out the 16" supreme and loved it. Especially loved the cornmeal crust, and while I personally prefer a spicier sauce, I need to try another pie with extra sauce before I can really judge it properly.

I also talked to them about the use of msg purported by another yelp reviewer, and they of course confirmed that they don't use msg in their pies. I can't imagine that they would use it in a pizza, but just wanted to help clear the air (not sure why the other reviewer would make such a claim).

Welcome to the neighborhood Firehouse!
author: Chris S.

description: They make great pizza.  What else you can say?  They area good bunch of blokes too.  They'll chase you out the door just to make sure you got enough pepper and cheese to go with your delicious pizza.  Give them a shot, can't go wrong.
author: Chris S.

description: Saw the reviews and pictures on yelp ...and yet again yelp has failed...dont believe what you see on their yelp page. This is not a 4 star pizza joint! Save your money people, the pizza here tastes like a frozen pizza from the supermarket...probably even worse. I ordered the typical combo and it was pretty bad. The crust was soggy, the sauce tasted off, and the cheese was horrible and felt like i was chewing on gum. There so many other choices around sf to order from. The only reason im giving them 2 stars is because they got to my house pretty quick....but then again im only a few blocks away. Yeah not ordering from them anymore.....
author: R S.

description: Great pizza and even better service! I am always pleased after ordering from this shop. They over estimate delivery times, and thus I usually get my food sooner than I expect. The drivers are the most friendly in SF. I usually only get cheese, but it's the perfect blend of sauce, cheese, and crunchy crust (like tombstone but better). Highly recommend garlic knots as well!
author: Nate H.

description:
Pizza was pretty good, but not amazing. Website is really easy to order from.
Order showed up for delivery about 40 minutes later than predicted time, even though I live about 10 blocks down the road! When I called, the guy who picked up was a little grumpy.
author: Hannah J.

description: Not only is the pizza really good (thin crust & fresh ingredients!) but the people who work here are great.  My husband and I ordered a large pizza from here last night, but the delivery guy brought a medium.  We called to tell them about the mix-up and they apologized and delivered a small pizza to make up for it, without any attitude whatsoever.  Not only will we continue to support this great neighborhood joint, but I will tell everybody I know to support them as well.  Good customer service goes a long way!
author: Jacquie M.

description:
I gave this place a second chance and they screwed up again!  After waiting 1:15 for a delivery I called to check in.  I hear the guy who answered ask the staff where my pizza is and hear a couple of "we don't know's" after which he tells me "your pizza's on its way" as if I hadn't just heard a thing.  
15 minutes later I get a call back explaining that they found the pizza in an overlooked delivery bag and that they would send the new pizza in 40 minutes.   I told him to forget it.  He then said they would send the pizza in 10 minutes for free and put me at the top priority as he's saying to his staff, "throw that pizza back in the oven."  Again I told him to forget it but the least they could do was admit that they screwed up and lied when he said "your pizza is on it's way."  He would admit no guilt and just got argumentative stating "I offered you a free pizza, what do you want, the keys to the shop?!"  No, I wanted dinner, after a long day at work, delivered in less than an hour, hot.  I got nothing but excuses.  Lame!
I'll never order from them again.  Horrible customer service for a a rather mediocre pizza (not a lot of options out here) at steep prices.  So not worth it!
author: Lindo C.

description: I just moved here from Europe and was looking for a good pizza. THIS is what passes for 4-star pizza in San Francisco? Had two pizzas from here, both were bland and uninspiring. Artificial tasting dough and no flavor in the ingredients. And those garlic knots? Just as weak as the pizza. Would not buy again. Best part was the cute delivery girl.
author: Robert B.

description: I stopped over for the first time today and got a personal 6" sausage/mushroom.  The young man there was very nice and attentive.  Nothing like having pizza just out of the oven.  The cheese was stringy and the crust as thin and crispy.  I'll need to try another larger pie before I can make a really good assessment, but I'll be back again.  Drinks can be purchased from the store it's connected to, 6011 California Market (formerly Super K in the 80s).  It gives me childhood memories when I was going to Alamo elementary and stopping there to get a bag of chips with all the coins I saved.
author: Alvin J.

description: I ordered a 10" half spicy bacon cheeseburger and half veggie supreme and they were soooo goood. (Personally, 10" is a personal size, so luckily I decided to order that instead of minis last minute.) Anyways, there was this sausage on the bacon cheeseburger side that I just adored. I don't know what was special about it, but it just tasted reaaaallyyy good. The only con about the spicy bacon cheeseburger was that the spiceyness kinda numbed my mouth when I ate it so I couldn't experience all the flavors the entire time /: However, I did alternate with the veggie supreme so I got some relief while eating that! To be honest, I think I liked the veggie side more than the spicy cheeseburger! There was an abundance of veggies and the tomato sauce was delicious. The crust wasn't soggy and it was a little crunchy too! The only reason this review is 4 stars is because of the price and phone service. For $15 I could've gotten double the pizza at Domino's or somewhere. Second, the guy on the phone was rude.. Nuff said.
author: Holly P.

description: Very solid option in the Outer Richmond. Their salads are good - the pizza is too. Typically our first call on Friday night or for team lunches at the office.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Got delivery from here last night came pretty fast, The Greek salad had a few too many onions and no cucumbers and kinda wished they had better olives since I paid like $7 something for a salad that was pretty small was just those canned olives that they use on pizza that are kinda bland. Pizza was pretty good I got a Hawaiian without ham and really liked it they had some sort of BBQ Sauce on it definitely will order again price was reasonable next time I'll stick with another salad though wasn't very impressed with it.  Also had a decent crust too many places are soggy or greasy and this was not.
author: Nirea S.

description:
So glad there's tasty, solid and dependable pizza in my neighborhood, let alone the pizza wasteland that is the west coast. Sorry, but y'all don't know pizza like the east coast.

I have had "New York" style pizza in SF and...well, it doesn't compare at all. The perfect trifecta of nicely spiced sauce, good tasting and appropriate amounts of cheese and a crust that is simultaneously crispy on the outside and soft warm bready goodness on the inside. No place else has had that combination in SF in my ten years of living here.

The other thing I appreciate about firehouse is consistency, the pies are always hot, tasty and delivered quickly in my experience. You go guys!

Oh, and not a big deal for me, personally, but I think it's great that they offer vegan cheese and gluten free crust for those with extranormal dietary considerations.
author: Rocky H.

description: One of the best pizzas I've had in a long time.  I had the Goat cheese speciality pizza and every bite was delicious.  The ingredients were fresh, the staff friendly, and the prices reasonable.  There's no dining room and only a few tables outside, so this is primarily a take-out pizza place.
author: Sam B.

description: It is really awesome to be able to get vegan pizza DELIVERED. It's awesome to get vegan pizza at all! The pizza was pretty good, but the crust was a little thin for my taste.
author: Natalie C.

description: I ordered a Greek Pesto Pizza and added an extra topping of sausage. Fabulous pizza! The flavor was raved over by everyone that tried it. It was simply as good as it gets! Will definitely be back in the future!
author: Hannah M.

description: We are one picky family when it comes to pizza and boy, does Firehouse Pizzeria deliver! No pun intended. I am allergic to gluten but still crave (and dream of) a good pizza. My GF pizza was awesome, the crust was crispy yet a little chewy. And my husband's non GF pizza got rave reviews! We should support local businesses!
author: Veronica A.

description:
We get a Firehouse pizza at least once a week because we love it so much! We always create our own so I can't speak to the standard pizzas on their menu, but the overall quality is great. An extra large pizza (16") is about 2 or 3 meals worth for 2 people, but could probably last longer if we didn't want to eat so much of it at once because it's so delicious! 

As far as pizza style is concerned, they have a thin crust (something I usually avoid, but actually really like here) that's mostly chewy with some crunchy parts right around the edges. They have a thin to medium layer of cheese (unless you ask for extra) followed by a hefty serving of toppings. Their pizzas are definitely full to the brim and usually more with the meats and veggies than sauce or cheese. 

If you're looking for recommendations on what to order, this is what we usually get (it's complicated and sounds a bit ridiculous, but it's really, really good): 

1/2 buffalo sauce with grilled chicken and smoked bacon
1/2 tomato (or sometimes BBQ) sauce with sausage, pepperoni and salami
and spinach, mushrooms, red onions, red peppers, and avocado on the whole thing.

It's usually around $30-$32 for an extra large (16") including tax.  

Definitely worth trying and there's free delivery nearby on orders over $15.
author: Jamila B.

description: I love Firehouse!  The Veggie Supreme has 4 kinds of peppers and it is always fresh!  The staff is always pleasant.
author: Kacie M.

description: These guys are awesome!!! Not only is their pizza great, so is their customer service. Ordered delivery and the guy forgot my soda. Instead of just crediting me for it, he went back to go and get it (luckily they're close and it only took a few minutes, but still).
author: Nicole R.

description: I was excited to make this my neighborhood pizza place, and decided to walk there to grab my medium veggie supreme pizza. They told me they made a small pizza by accident but for NO charge I'd get an additional personal pizza. They said that about 3 times, as if I was supposed to tip for their gesture. The personal pizza was just enough to make a medium pizza so I don't know what favor they did me. The recipe of the pizza was horrible, the tomato sauce tasted like a spaghetti sauce out of a jar, the veggies weren't even fully cooked. And the sauce itself was so sweet, not my idea of a good pizza. Then the buffalo wings I ordered were so spicy my lips were burning. Overall the frozen pizza I get tastes better than this place. Never going back here, not even in an emergency.  Also the crew who works on Saturday nights needs to stop sucking up just to get tips.
author: S K.

description: I am so excited that this has moved into the back of super K.  It is an exciting addition to the neighborhood.  That said my pizza was just fine.  I have not written it off though.
author: Cork C.

description:
I was really dubious about the viability of a new pizza place opening so close to a couple of long-term neighborhood veterans, but after tasting their stuff, I am a convert!

Garlic knots are unique, yummy, addictive and cheap - try them. Just on the verge of being slightly underdone inside and crispy on the outside, as proper bready goodness should be.

I had a Supremo pizza, which was crispy, crunchy and saucy in all the right places, ingredients were super fresh, and what I liked the best was the lack of grease anywhere.

Staff was friendly and delivery swift - we ordered right at the closing time from a nearby cafe we were hanging at after hours, and they delivered in about 20 mins (!). Alas, it smelled so good, *everyone* wanted a slice. High praises from all, too.

Hope this place stays around. It's a cut above most pizza I had in the city, and the people who run it (and the store it's in) are super nice.
author: Sandra B.

description:
As the newest pizza joint in town, I knew I had to have it. Let me preface by saying the guys who work here are very nice, and I was still inclined to tip them when I came to pick up my pies.

There is nothing wrong with the pizza here, but it's not in your face special or anything. Again, I prefer super thin and crispy crust, so that always makes the difference for me when evaluating a good pizza. It is, of course, a subjective thing. When you crave pizza, any pizza will do. I will still be supporting my local neighborhood joints over franchises.
author: Jeanne C.

description: The crust is great, the options were superb. It was quick and easy to pick up my order. Love it, will be my to go place for takeouts.
author: Mahadev K.

description: I ordered a half and half pizza, garlic knots and a salad for delivery. The ratio of toppings, cheese and sauce was perfect. I liked the thin crust but found it a bit doughy. The flavors on the Luau pizza and Goat Cheese pizza are well balanced and not at all greasy. The garlic knots were a little burned and didn't come with sauce. I was surprised I wasn't asked if I wanted sauce (I just assumed it would come with marinara). I would definitely order delivery again but will remember to ask for all the fixins.
author: Nicole S.

description: As with many places I review, I tried this while in town on business.  The guys working there were very friendly and there was good convo to be had.  At first I was just going to order a regular pizza but he told me that it would not be up to my standards, being that I am from NY.  So I opted to try the spicy bacon cheeseburger pizza and a side of garlic knots.  The garlic knots were great and the pizza was OKAY.  It wasn't really THAT good.. and I had a stomach ache for a few hours after eating it.
author: Adam B.

description: Fantastic Me-N-Ed's style pizza. Crispy crust and a good amount of toppings. No skimping on the good stuff. Only little complaint was there was too much cheese. I would rate 4.5 stars if I could because of that, but since I can't they deserve the round up. Thanks, FHP!
author: Guy M.

description: I've been to Firehouse several times and can say that the pizza is pretty good for both delivery and take out.  However, the customer service here needs a major improvement.  A couple of weeks ago my boyfriend and I ordered delivery and the phone number was taken down incorrectly.  Rather than looking up our information in the computer or trying to track down the placed call from our address history, they simply didn't deliver the pizza.  When we called to inquire about the status of our order we were told that the driver returned because we didn't answer the phone.  After everything was sorted out our pizza was delivered 45 minutes late and we were promised a 20% discount next time.  Fine, I can appreciate that.  Yet the next time we ordered pizza there was "no record" of the discount.  Then this past weekend I ordered take-out to avoid any mistakes yet upon arrival (30 minutes after I placed the order and was told to come in) the pizza was not even in the oven.  I heard "sorry" about twenty times but it doesn't do much when mistakes are constantly being made.
author: Lidia L.

description: Ordered the Supremo combination.  At last, a thin crust pizza of just the right consistency.  Highly recommend.
author: Philip R.

description: I actually tried their pizza a few times and let me say that i really like it. It's much better then Round Table and Dominos. I would consider eating at this place again.
author: Alex T.

description: Finally!!!!  Decent delivery in the Richmond.  Pizza was great.  Salad was fresh, crisp.  I'm a fan.
author: Colin S.

description: Mmmmm. SO GOOD. Love the veggie pizza. Love the chicken wings. I wanted to chase the delivery man down and give him a hug. They were all so friendly- the delivered to my office even though we were slightly out of range, they called to let me know it was on the way, they offered speedy delivery.. I will take your advice, pizza delivery man, and I will go in person one day. I couldn't stop eating (isn't that a bad thing? Who cares) Officially Uniworld's new pizza place.  Y U M
author: Dana S.

description: I really appreciate the diligence these guys have in addressing my concerns.  Business owners should take a lesson in this.  Their response and concern about my patronage really means alot to me.  I will support this business and urge others, who appreciate honest and genuine proprietors, to do the same.  My faith in society is coming back!
author: goldberg d.

description: This place has officially become my pizza delivery go to place! Pizza was delivered promptly (earlier than what I was told +++), delicious, crispy crust, no skimping with the toppings... all around YUM!!!
author: M O.

description: Pizza is delish!  Ordered pepperoni and olives, and it came with thin crust (not sure if thats their style or they got our order wrong).  Nice alternative to Seniore's, which usually takes 1.5+ hours for delivery.
author: Trevor T.

description: Staff is really nice. The pizza is not great, but not bad. It's the best in the Richmond District, that I've had so far.
author: Tim M.

description: Best pizza I've ever had and the garlic  bread knots are to die for!!!
author: Ashley T.

description: Not sure what happened here. This was the best gluten free pizza in the city but we just ordered and the crust was very different this time- thick, strange texture and zero flavor. We didn't eat the pizza and that rarely happens. Not sure what's going on??? I hope this crust is not here to stay.
author: Ashley F.

description: Unbelievably disappointed in my first experience with this establishment -- cannot believe it has survived in San Francisco?  Called to order pizza at noon - was told to call back in 10 minutes as the pizza maker was out on a delivery.  Called again at 12.15 and was told to call back in 10 more minutes as they were still out on a delivery.  Called again at 12.25 and was told "sorry, we don't deliver".  Asked to speak with the manager, a guy named Zack said "i'm the only one working and its like raining outside".  Are you serious?
author: Kevin F.

description: wonderful pizza, great service! i tried out the supreme at first and have always ordered it since then! Firehouse has now become my weekly pizzeria...
author: Lazeeb C.

description: These guys rock!!  Whether for a single slice during the week, or for a whole pizza on the weekend, this is my new favorite place.  Whether you need vegetarian, vegan, or a gluten-free pizza, these guys can make it work for ya!  And within walking distance from my place, and connected to the California Market, I will be back very soon...
author: Carol K.

description: I called in with questions since this was my first time ordering, and Seth answered the phone. He was courteous and he helped me with various menu items. I went with the 16 inch extra large BBQ chicken pizza. It was quite good. The delivery was very prompt. Would definitely order form them again.
author: Richard C.

description: Their pizza is my new favorite pizza for delivery. Delicious! and the delivery folks are always very friendly.
author: Jenny T.

description: I just can't get enough of this amazing pizza place -- everything about it is terrific. The pizza is fantastic and the fact that they offer gluten-free makes my family so happy (vegan is available too). The guys and gals working there treat us like friends and family -- the perfect neighborhood pizzeria. Love them!
author: Amy S.

description: i've had firehouse twice. first time, pretty good. second time, not so good. i'll try one more time and make my final decision. but as it stands today 3/5. whiat i like is that the crust is like a round table crust; thin and buttery, and they mix 2 cheeses, chedder adn mozzarella- which i love. i asked for a garlic cheese pizza on this last order, the garlic was buried under the cheese and didn't cook, so each time i took a bite it was like taking a bite of little garlic nuggets, if it was on the top, it would have tasted more roasted and creamy. we also ordered the garlic knots which were delish, but they came with a side of COLD marinara sauce, which if you eat warm buttery garlic knots, you want to dip them in a warm marinara sauce, not marinara out of the fridge. with all that said, this place still deserves another chance.
author: SF Native M.

description:
Great local spot sorely needed in this part of the city.

So far so good, only issue I would mention is that sometimes the phone takes a while to get answered.  

Awesome that you can order alcohol from the connected store.
author: Luis M.

description: Just had my first pizza from Firehouse and was blown away! By far the best pizza I've had in the city, and reasonably priced. Perfect addition to this part of the Richmond. My only fear is that now I'll never order anything other than the Buffalo Chicken with bacon from this place.
author: Alex S.

description: I stumbled on this fabulous little pizza place as I was walking home on 22nd Ave.  I noticed the sign outside, so I walked in with much hope and anticipation. I mentioned to them that I had been put Xmas shopping all day and was very tired.  They handed me a take out menu and that they delivered.  Perfect is what I thought to myself!  I called in and ordered the Margherita pizza.  You simply can't go wrong with fresh basil, red sauce, mozzarella, cherry tomatoes and garlic.  Yum!  The garlic knots are really flavorful and tasty too.  I am so happy to have found this place and I wish them much success!
author: Rebecca S.

description: Amazing, delicious gluten-free pizza. I don't live in the neighborhood but it's really worth the drive. Addictive.
author: mademoiselle m.

description: Just tried to phone an order and got this snot who told his friend "I was going to let it ring but some guy wants a pizza" then laughs his head off. I don't care how good the pizza is the service sucks! Wouldn't go into the store it's connected to. Giorgio pizza rules!
author: Linda M.

description: Love this place.  Pizza is great.  My fav is the meat lovers pizza
author: Rachal R.

description: Had to change my review from a five star, great neighborhood pizza joint. It's gone downhill: they definitely use lower quality cheese than before and there's a lot of oil or something in crust to make it crispy. Plus, prices have gone up. Now, no better than average.
author: jeff w.

description: Fresh ingredients and some creative pies are the highlights here.   If you're looking for standard cheese and pepperoni they won't disappoint, but if you want something interesting and different check out their menu.  Good stuff!
author: James P.

description: I ordered a supreme veggie pizza to go and it was super good. I really liked the sauce and there were plenty of toppings.  After walking halfway home, it donned on me that I should have picked up some beer too since a grocery store is attached. Next time. The employees were really nice and I will definitely go back.  I can't imagine eating there though because the space is tiny and I'm not a fan of eating while sitting on a stool.  They deliver for orders over $15, which is a pretty reasonable price.
author: k h.

description: We love the pizza, ordered 3 times so far, all on time and hot.  I'll give you the 5th star after I am sure the consistency remains great.  Keep up the good work.   We will continue to recommend you guys to all.
author: sondra g.

description: We've tried 2 of their specials: the BBQ and Buffalo chicken pizzas. Both were outstanding and balanced all their favors without being overwhelming. Great thin crusts and bonus point for accommodating our half and half pizza requests.
author: Diana Z.

description: Finally stopped by our new neighborhood pizzeria.  After a 10 mile morning run then walking around the Union St. Art Festival, their Supreme Pizza and Greek Salad (sans onion) was the perfect, yummy choice to refuel. The pizza sauce was particularly tasty. Looking forward to being a regular customer.  Congratulations!
author: Bailey P.

description: A solid pizza joint...not trying to be any of those artisnal pizzas that have been sprouting everywhere, but more like a family style pizza that you'd expect from fast-food chains.  Reminds me of a better Round Table (and no, this is not a negative comment at all).   My only drawback would probably be its price, but it costs as much as Round Table without a coupon, so it still somewhat works out.  I would definitely come back when I am in the need for non-fancy pizza.
author: A W.

description: I am so picky with my pizza! This has to be one of my favorites! Along with the generous portions of toppings, it's a must have!
author: Carolina L.

description: Very, very happy with the 'Italian'.  Very, very, very happy that I can get good delivered pizza in the outer Richmond!  Enjoyed the buffalo wings as well.  Great blue cheese dressing.  Will definitely order again soon.  I've heard the 'Goat' is fantastic.
author: Tj A.

description: One taste of the buffalo chicken pizza would have been enough had it not also been for the phone call ordering said pizza. Decided to have the pizza without red onions and the conversation that ensued (guy thought I was making a BIG mistake) out me in a great mood and when I actually tasted the thing, my oh my. Neighborhood people making really good food and enjoying their business and customers made changing my initial review from 4 stars to 5 stars easy and the fact that they deliver to the outer Richmond made it all perfect.
author: David B.

description: This is the BEST pizza, I am a huge fan!! Fresh, delicious -- and they have gluten-free crust if you need it. Seriously, a neighborhood favorite already, and fantastic crew who works there. Love love love it -- A
author: Amy S.

description: After having the gluten free pizza I was simi impressed... then I thought I would go out to try other pizza places. My conclusion, they have all sucked thus far. I am now very impressed by Firehouse! The crust is thin, and crunchy, the sauce is yummy and the cheese is always well balanced. Cons, its in high demand, making delivery take a while. I can't blame them though; the gluten free pizza is great! P.s. if you are dairy intolerant or allergic I hear they also have dairy free cheese. I am allergic to gluten, sad face, but I refuse to give up the small things in life. I need pizza and chocolate, among some other things... But this isn't the place for that. Did I mention that there is a mimi mart attached to this fine establishment? A.k.A you can pick up some wine or beer to go along with your dinner. Minimum delivery order is $15 so if you only get once gluten free pizza you may want to order a salad, heck why not order 2 pizzas? Bon appétit!
author: Star Z.
